subject: Fix missing pass-through of cluster_auth_enabled parameter
messages: [{'account_id': 23887, 'date': '2018-04-18 12:36:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-04-18 13:24:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-23 16:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-18 12:36:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix missing pass-through of cluster_auth_enabled parameter

pacemaker::new accepts parameter cluster_auth_enabled, but did
not pass this to pacemaker::new::setup. Therefore it was not
possible to enable cluster_auth with this parameter, since it defaults
to false in pacemaker::new::params.

Change-Id: I8d0cece9dfec82ed58035c876895881a4b918c82
'}]
commit_message:
Fix missing pass-through of cluster_auth_enabled parameter

pacemaker::new accepts parameter cluster_auth_enabled, but did
not pass this to pacemaker::new::setup. Therefore it was not
possible to enable cluster_auth with this parameter, since it defaults
to false in pacemaker::new::params.

Change-Id: I8d0cece9dfec82ed58035c876895881a4b918c82

subject: Ceph backfill and recovery options require config overrides
messages: [{'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-04-18 20:29:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-04-18 20:32:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-04-18 20:34:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-04-19 10:45:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-23 16:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-18 20:29:01.000000000', 'message': 'Ceph backfill and recovery options require config overrides

Example in the documentation was wrong. CephAnsibleExtraConfig
overrides any variable from ceph-ansible/group_vars, but
osd_recovery_op_priority, osd_recovery_max_active, and
osd_max_backfills are not in ceph-ansible/group_vars.
Instead use CephConfigOverrides to directly modify ceph.conf.

Change-Id: I3afe87db14378156907f8b31d91cb17ad7827bdd
'}, {'created': '2018-04-18 20:34:20.000000000', 'message': 'Ceph backfill and recovery options require config overrides

Example in the documentation was wrong. CephAnsibleExtraConfig
overrides any variable from ceph-ansible/group_vars, but
osd_recovery_op_priority, osd_recovery_max_active, and
osd_max_backfills are not in ceph-ansible/group_vars.
Instead use CephConfigOverrides to directly modify ceph.conf.

Change-Id: I3afe87db14378156907f8b31d91cb17ad7827bdd
'}]
commit_message:
Ceph backfill and recovery options require config overrides

Example in the documentation was wrong. CephAnsibleExtraConfig
overrides any variable from ceph-ansible/group_vars, but
osd_recovery_op_priority, osd_recovery_max_active, and
osd_max_backfills are not in ceph-ansible/group_vars.
Instead use CephConfigOverrides to directly modify ceph.conf.

Change-Id: I3afe87db14378156907f8b31d91cb17ad7827bdd

[{'created': '2018-04-23 09:20:50.000000000', 'message': "bagpipe-bgp: strictly avoid having same VNI in two VPN instances

In some BGPVPN interconnection scenarios, two EVPNs may be
configured for bagpipe-bgp with same VNI.

This can't be supported by the linux vxlan driver (only a
single vxlan interface can be created for a given VXLAN id,
and it can't be plugged in more than one bridge).

change.

For these reason, the right thing is to reject the creation
of an EVPN instance having same VNI than another instance.

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: strictly avoid having same VNI in two VPN instances

In some BGPVPN interconnection scenarios, two EVPNs may be
configured for bagpipe-bgp with same VNI.

This can't be supported by the linux vxlan driver (only a
single vxlan interface can be created for a given VXLAN id,
and it can't be plugged in more than one bridge).

This would be supported by the EVPN OVS driver with some
change.

For these reason, the right thing is to reject the creation
of an EVPN instance having same VNI than another instance.

Closes-Bug: 1765764

Change-Id: Ia36c0d17031042bada1df6945573cb2dabf5560a

commit_message:
Add validation for checking baremetal boot images

Check that the baremetal boot images exist, and that there is only
one of them in glance.

Change-Id: Ia23f910cdfd0d41f984758235738d2e371cd37f4
Implements: blueprint workflow-move-validations

Currently when deleting a nova-compute service via the API, we will
(soft) delete the service and compute_node records in the DB, but the
placement resource provider and host mapping records will be orphaned.
This patch deletes the resource provider and host_mapping records
before deleting the service/compute node.

Closes-Bug: #1756179

commit_message:
Cleanup RP and HM records while deleting a compute service.

Currently when deleting a nova-compute service via the API, we will
(soft) delete the service and compute_node records in the DB, but the
placement resource provider and host mapping records will be orphaned.
This patch deletes the resource provider and host_mapping records
before deleting the service/compute node.

Change-Id: I7b8622b178d5043ed1556d7bdceaf60f47e5ac80
Closes-Bug: #1756179

commit_message:
Resolve common roles required for test

This change adds a common test role requirements file to the
preparation process whch will ensure all required common roles are
available prior to running tests.

As we move to use common roles throughout our deliverables this change
will help ensure we're not having to map complex common dependencies
throughout our supported roles, which is prone to human error and can
cause cascading failures throughout out stack should a requirement be
missed.

Change-Id: If3c57d5c864aee3a6bc461dead367eac7f3eede2
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: [verify] Ger rid of calling pip internals
messages: [{'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-04-17 15:47:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-04-23 14:50:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 15:47:01.000000000', 'message': '[verify] Ger rid of calling pip internals

In case of system-wide mode of verifiers, Rally tryies to check whether
tool's requirements feets what we have installed in the system
environment or not.

Previously we used helpers from pip library. Unfortunately, pip team
decided to mark these helpers as "internal" and it becomes an issue for
us with pip>=10.0

This patch migrates our checks to use pkg_resources .

Change-Id: I6f5fb6c1f71c3e0b2c59481b00907d08e32c8eb1
'}]
commit_message:
[verify] Ger rid of calling pip internals

In case of system-wide mode of verifiers, Rally tryies to check whether
tool's requirements feets what we have installed in the system
environment or not.

Previously we used helpers from pip library. Unfortunately, pip team
decided to mark these helpers as "internal" and it becomes an issue for
us with pip>=10.0

This patch migrates our checks to use pkg_resources .

Change-Id: I6f5fb6c1f71c3e0b2c59481b00907d08e32c8eb1

commit_message:
Revert "Operator for start/end_timestamp changes to 'eq'"

This reverts commit b540674a84b096d3df7dfaf8004c5f6bfa4adcc1.

This changes is wrong in the sense as it removes the ability to filter via ge/le the start and end timestamps.

Change-Id: I0c82917a6fd6795266e34b4d151faf13f43ab5bb

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: Iefad7ba17f01d2982567e7f1f207ecb29d093e83

Until ONTAP v8.3, the driver used to perform sub-lun clone of up to 64GB
per operation, but as of v9.1, ONTAP handles only 128MB per operation.
This new limit is causing error on volume extending operations, which
triggers sub-lun cloning when resizing exceeds max-resize-geometry.
For instance, if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, the operation
fails because it triggers a single sub-lun cloning of 1GB.

if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, it no longer fails, and
instead it will trigger 8 sub-lun cloning operations of 128MB.

Change-Id: Ib294cbdbdfe19d34a7702dafec2c8d29136a2f25
Closes-Bug: #1762424
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Set new sub-lun clone limit for ONTAP driver

Until ONTAP v8.3, the driver used to perform sub-lun clone of up to 64GB
per operation, but as of v9.1, ONTAP handles only 128MB per operation.
This new limit is causing error on volume extending operations, which
triggers sub-lun cloning when resizing exceeds max-resize-geometry.
For instance, if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, the operation
fails because it triggers a single sub-lun cloning of 1GB.

This fix sets the limit used by sub-lun cloning to 128MB, therefore
if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, it no longer fails, and
instead it will trigger 8 sub-lun cloning operations of 128MB.

Change-Id: Ib294cbdbdfe19d34a7702dafec2c8d29136a2f25
Closes-Bug: #1762424

When upgrading to a containerized undercloud, we want to restore
55-heat-config file which has been removed by instack-undercloud during
the previous undercloud deploy or upgrade to clean up the elements.

The file is needed by Ansible tasks to configure Heat resources on the
hosts.

Change-Id: Ie0240fc9d68bf2cea82a09d4e847e398923c9bf2
Closes-Bug: #1765589
'}]
commit_message:
Re-install 55-heat-config during undercloud upgrade

When upgrading to a containerized undercloud, we want to restore
55-heat-config file which has been removed by instack-undercloud during
the previous undercloud deploy or upgrade to clean up the elements.

The file is needed by Ansible tasks to configure Heat resources on the
hosts.

Change-Id: Ie0240fc9d68bf2cea82a09d4e847e398923c9bf2
Closes-Bug: #1765589

Bindep is a tool for checking the presence of binary packages needed
to use an application / library. It started life as a way to make it
easier to set up a development environment for OpenStack projects.

commit_message:
Neutron: Enable sharing of network namespaces with host

This PS enables sharing of network namespaces with the host,
allowing for hitless upgrades of agents, and much simpler debugging.

It does however require mount propogation to be enabled in kubernetes
which is a alpha gated feature introduced in 1.8, and enabled by default
as a beta feature in 1.10.

Depends-On: I7a37f45ff6061b144c6f04233712cd84fccb3e83

subject: py3: Fix test_utils on Python 3.5
messages:
[{'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2018-04-13 14:06:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-04-17 04:46:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Cool, thanks Victor!

The pep35 failed, it thinks that python 3.5 does return the second facility section.

  - [((), {'address': '/foo/bar', 'facility': 19})]
  + [((), {'address': '/foo/bar', 'facility': 19}), ((), {'facility': 19})]

I don't know exactly what version of py3.5 ran.. is it suppose to be all versions of py35? or was it at some micro version?"}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2018-04-17 09:22:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

On my Fedora 27 with Python 3.5.4, I get the following error on master:

======================================================================
FAIL: test_get_logger_sysloghandler_plumbing (test.unit.common.test_utils.TestUtils)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/vstinner/prog/openstack/swift/test/unit/common/test_utils.py", line 1603, in test_get_logger_sysloghandler_plumbing
    syslog_handler_args)
AssertionError: Lists differ: [((), {'facility': 19, 'address': '/foo/bar'}), ((), {'facility': 19})] != [((), {'facility': 19, 'address': '/foo/bar'})]

First list contains 1 additional elements.
First extra element 1:
((), {'facility': 19})

- [((), {'address': '/foo/bar', 'facility': 19}), ((), {'facility': 19})]
?                                           ------------------------

+ [((), {'address': '/foo/bar', 'facility': 19})]
    """Fail immediately, with the given message."""
>>  raise self.failureException("Lists differ: [((), {'facility': 19, 'address': '/foo/bar'}), ((), {'facility': 19})] != [((), {'facility': 19, 'address': '/foo/bar'})]\n\nFirst list contains 1 additional elements.\nFirst extra element 1:\n((), {'facility': 19})\n\n- [((), {'address': '/foo/bar', 'facility': 19}), ((), {'facility': 19})]\n?                                           ------------------------\n\n+ [((), {'address': '/foo/bar', 'facility': 19})]")'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:58:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I remember running into this and noticed that Fedora and Ubuntu are shipping different microversions of py3.5. I think the fix to this problem should be in the logic of the code thou, not the tests. I looked at it quickly, but it seemed to be coded with some expecations of python behavior that are no longer true for python > 3.5'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2018-04-23 15:42:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:

On Python 3.5 and 3.6, the following test fail:

The second call is not done on Python 3.5 and newer.

commit_message:
py3: Fix test_utils on Python 3.5

On Python 3.5 and 3.6, the following test fail:

FAIL: test_get_logger_sysloghandler_plumbing (test.unit.common.test_utils.TestUtils)

The second call is not done on Python 3.5 and newer.

Change-Id: I0e79c4a86763959fcf9130a39009476a20d492e3

subject: Fix signal handling on Python 3.5
messages:
[{'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2017-07-28 13:33:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2017-07-28 13:35:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

While I'm quite sure that a "self pipe" is the only solution to fix the bug, I have technical issues with fork() and the pipe. It seems like the pipe is shared between the parent and child processes, whereas I would like to have a "private" "self pipe" per process. I guess that I need to "duplicate" (close/create a new) pipe in the child process after a fork?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-28 15:07:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-oslo.service-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/21/488421/1/check/gate-oslo.service-docs-ubuntu-xenial/711ddeb//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 22s
- gate-oslo.service-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/21/488421/1/check/gate-oslo.service-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/a1bd735/ : SUCCESS in 6m 27s
- gate-oslo.service-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/21/488421/1/check/gate-oslo.service-python27-ubuntu-xenial/2eab486/ : SUCCESS in 4m 20s
- gate-oslo.service-python35-nv http://logs.openstack.org/21/488421/1/check/gate-oslo.service-python35-nv/e62369b/ : FAILURE in 4m 20s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.service-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/21/488421/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.service-ubuntu-xenial/d710fa6/ : SUCCESS in 1h 32m 20s'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2018-04-23 15:42:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-28 13:33:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix signal handling on Python 3.5

On Python 3.5, SignalHandler._handle_signal() doesn't run the
greenthread immediately if eventlet is waiting for events in its hub,
because of the Python PEP 475.

On Python 3.5, add a self-pipe used by _handle_signal() to make sure
that the event loop is awaken.

Change-Id: I2d522726ec33b6635b0b835d4261a9ac423c1ac6
Closes-Bug: #1705047
"}]
commit_message:
Fix signal handling on Python 3.5

On Python 3.5, SignalHandler._handle_signal() doesn't run the
greenthread immediately if eventlet is waiting for events in its hub,
because of the Python PEP 475.

On Python 3.5, add a self-pipe used by _handle_signal() to make sure
that the event loop is awaken.

Change-Id: I2d522726ec33b6635b0b835d4261a9ac423c1ac6
Closes-Bug: #1705047

commit_message:
Use a priority queue for port status reports.

Snapshot updates and retries are given low priorities.
Updates for the event stream skip the queue.

This gives us eventual consistency while ensuring that
new port creations are prioritised.

Change-Id: Id4d30121dd3bf86b05a92c6934607249d4e7376d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-21 17:59:26.000000000', 'message': 'Disable openstack-nova-consoleauth service during FFU

After upgrade openstack-nova-consoleauth service runs inside a
container so the systemd service needs to be disabled. This change
disables the service during the fast forward upgrade tasks.

Change-Id: If1e0f43c1962496b68c1c982db86a6dec58e05c5
Closes-bug: 1765997
'}, {'created': '2018-04-23 04:08:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix openstack-nova-consoleauth service upgrade check

When running the FFU workflow the openstack-nova-consoleauth
service gets stopped before running the upgrade tasks so the
task for disabling the service is ignored. This change fixes
the nova_consoleauth_enabled command to check if the service
is enabled instead of active.

Change-Id: If1e0f43c1962496b68c1c982db86a6dec58e05c5
Closes-bug: 1765997
'}]
commit_message:
Fix openstack-nova-consoleauth service upgrade check

When running the FFU workflow the openstack-nova-consoleauth
service gets stopped before running the upgrade tasks so the
task for disabling the service is ignored. This change fixes
the nova_consoleauth_enabled command to check if the service
is enabled instead of active.

Change-Id: If1e0f43c1962496b68c1c982db86a6dec58e05c5
Closes-bug: 1765997

subject: Must be used as _i18n to indicate that it is a private implementation detail
messages:
[{'account_id': 15285, 'date': '2018-04-22 23:43:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15285, 'date': '2018-04-22 23:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Please refer https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.i18n/latest/user/usage.html

Note:

Libraries probably do not want to expose the new integration module as part of their public API, so rather than naming it myapp.i18n it should be called myapp._i18n to indicate that it is a private implementation detail, and not meant to be used outside of the librarys own code.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-04-23 02:26:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I understand the motivation of this change and I agree with it. However there is already a i18n module under qinlingclient, please rename that module to _i18n using a "git mv" instead of adding a new file. And please change the imports of qinlingclient.i18n to the new module in the project.'}, {'account_id': 15285, 'date': '2018-04-23 15:08:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15285, 'date': '2018-04-23 15:26:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Support zuul's standard override-checkout variable

Similar change to ironic's dcc5546b49ad7a791a00284999e6db4a802792b1.
Allows using inspector's jobs in the ironic-tempest-plugin gate.

Conflicts:
	playbooks/legacy/ironic-inspector-grenade-dsvm/run.yaml
	playbooks/legacy/ironic-inspector-tempest-dsvm-discovery/run.yaml
	playbooks/legacy/ironic-inspector-tempest-dsvm-python3/run.yaml

(cherry picked from commit 1fc3bfa6d28810345092eb350ba9b031b425c1e8)

commit_message:
Support zuul's standard override-checkout variable

Similar change to ironic's dcc5546b49ad7a791a00284999e6db4a802792b1.
Allows using inspector's jobs in the ironic-tempest-plugin gate.

commit_message:
Add docker packages to dhcp and l3 agent containers

The dhcp and l3 neutron agent containers need to be able to launch
docker containers for their subprocesses.

Change-Id: I8d93f4eccde1dc6e55e10399184ee80671355769
Related-Bug: #1749209
(cherry picked from commit 66ad3f8d1975966b644e704d5e0a538b0fbd4eaa)

commit_message:
Update gabbi to 1.42.1 for heat-tempest-plugin

The heat-tempest-plugin needs to use gabbi 1.42.1 in order
to be able to list tests when the target host is either
unknown or unreachable.  This was not possible with gabbi
versions < 1.42.1.  So this updates the upper constraint
to make sure that the heat-tempest-plugin can specify this
version of gabbi.

Change-Id: Ie5793f0b28a3a843977f51e66c23b4e534ec77b3
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544025/

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Ie26f236c0d1d433e0bb69da4fcb251a4e40a5615
Partial-Bug: #1764470

commit_message:
update lower-constraints.txt to match *requirements.txt

Packages in lower-constraints.txt appear to have higher
versions than the minimals in *requirements.txt. The CI
job catches that and fails.

This patch borrows lower-constraints.txt from the current
"requirements" repo.

Change-Id: I222df44ace687cfb9c936bd0a60eb43715435a3b

subject: Avoid recreation of MySQL indexes
messages:
[{'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-21 17:53:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25167, 'date': '2018-04-23 03:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-23 07:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-04-23 07:52:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

+1 because I'd like to see more explanations from Qi Peng."}, {'account_id': 25167, 'date': '2018-04-23 09:07:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > +1 because I'd like to see more explanations from Qi Peng.

There are two situations(mysql).
1.My database version is 024, The index of task_execution_id named "task_execution_id". I'm upgrading database from 024 to 026. The index of task_execution_id also named "task_execution_id".
2.My database version is 026, The index of task_execution_id named
"workflow_executions_v2_task_execution_id". I'm upgrading database from 026 to 026. The index of task_execution_id also named "workflow_executions_v2_task_execution_id".
Perhaps, we need change the index_name to "task_execution_id". Otherwise we need upgrade mysql.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-04-23 10:54:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> 2.My database version is 026, The index of task_execution_id named
 > "workflow_executions_v2_task_execution_id". I'm upgrading database
 > from 026 to 026. The index of task_execution_id also named
 > "workflow_executions_v2_task_execution_id".
 > Perhaps, we need change the index_name to "task_execution_id".
 > Otherwise we need upgrade mysql.

Hah! You're absolutely correct. Thanks. Vitalii, I agree, we need to take care of that.'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-23 14:53:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > 2.My database version is 026, The index of task_execution_id
 > named
 > > "workflow_executions_v2_task_execution_id". I'm upgrading
 > database
 > > from 026 to 026. The index of task_execution_id also named
 > > "workflow_executions_v2_task_execution_id".
 > > Perhaps, we need change the index_name to "task_execution_id".
 > > Otherwise we need upgrade mysql.
 > 
 > Hah! You're absolutely correct. Thanks. Vitalii, I agree, we need
 > to take care of that.

Honestly, i don't understand the problem.
But I can't change the name because a index name must be unique in PostgreSQL. 

 > 2.My database version is 026, The index of task_execution_id named
 > "workflow_executions_v2_task_execution_id". I'm upgrading database
 > from 026 to 026. The index of task_execution_id also named
 > "workflow_executions_v2_task_execution_id".

Noop. If you have database version is 026, the index of task_execution_id named task_execution_id. Why it will be 'workflow_executions_v2_task_execution_id'?'}]

commit_message:
Add support in nodepool-setup for branched tripleo-upgrade.

Currently we if the zuul_changes has some branched tripleo-upgrade
it's not taken into account, so master is always checkout.  This may
lead to patch failing to apply.

Change-Id: I2aee65f601e20bead118a6098983f59fddc63ae9

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix share size when creating from snapshot

The ONTAP driver was ignoring the size requested when
creating a share from an existing snapshot.

Closes-Bug: #1717263
(cherry picked from commit 719c88a125f7836fbfdf62c48871eed020bbe9cc)

Change-Id: I335f72a8dea49d5855201fc63a7ac22240b60bbf

commit_message:
dockerfile: Fix controller upper constraints

It was pointing to a web rendering of the upper constraints
instead of the plain text ones that pip needs.

Closes-Bug: #1763752
Change-Id: I0d43da4df470074397029df84701850d15a12d43

commit_message:
Remove use of Python builtin name for variables

'file' is a Python builtin name, and should not be used for a variable
name.

Fixes-Bug: #1763469

Change-Id: Ifb0a3fe51f995cee5d703be23ea444da3e837be6

This text looks good to me.  I still feel like this represents a shift from 18 months to EOL to 24 months to EOL: I'm not opposed to that, but do think that all interested parties need to consider the implications, even if the last 6 months basically consist of ignoring and not releasing the branch, just in case someone comes to maintain it."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-14 23:25:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> This text looks good to me.  I still feel like this represents a
 > shift from 18 months to EOL to 24 months to EOL: I'm not opposed to
 > that, but do think that all interested parties need to consider the
 > implications, even if the last 6 months basically consist of
 > ignoring and not releasing the branch, just in case someone comes
 > to maintain it.

Yeah I agree it's a big change.  One I think we can life with but once the resolution passes I'd expect to get a lot more discussion here and on the list ;P

Thanks for your patience and reviews :)"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-14 23:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Adding active members of the VMT for viewpoints on my statements about the VMT commitment for the new phases  (and other feedback of course)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-03-15 09:55:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

I like it, I will just bikeshed on the "Pre End of Life" period name.

"Pre-end-of-life" tends to point to a planned period just before EOL, while it really is the status you're in after Extended maintenance when the level of community engagement around it has been decreasing too much.

I would actually call that stage "Abandoned", which clearly describes why it's there. You switch to EOL because the branch has been abandoned for 6 months, not because it's been "Pre-EOL" for 6 months.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-15 12:54:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

I would be afraid calling it "abandoned" would sound too harsh and discourage potential revival. Maybe something more like "neglected"?'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-03-15 13:46:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Other potential synonyms: deserted, forsaken, jilted, stranded.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-15 14:29:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I like it, I will just bikeshed on the "Pre End of Life" period
 > name.
 > 
 > "Pre-end-of-life" tends to point to a planned period just before
 > EOL, while it really is the status you're in after Extended
 > maintenance when the level of community engagement around it has
 > been decreasing too much.
 > 
 > I would actually call that stage "Abandoned", which clearly
 > describes why it's there. You switch to EOL because the branch has
 > been abandoned for 6 months, not because it's been "Pre-EOL" for 6
 > months.

How about just "unmaintained"?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-15 14:34:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

+1 for unmaintained. I think that's a good and impartial declaration of the current state."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-16 21:49:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > I like it, I will just bikeshed on the "Pre End of Life" period

 > has

 > 6

 >

I actually really wanted to call it either abandoned or unmaintained.  I was worried they were a little negative/ passive aggressive.

I agree 'pre end of life is terrible''}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-16 21:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Integrate kuryr-kubernetes for container-based VNFs

This patch integrates kuryr-kubernetes for c-VNFs to enable
neutron-based networking for container-based VNFs.

commit_message:
Mention that users need noVNC >= 0.6

Apparently versions below 0.6 don't work with
the nova-novncproxy service.

Change-Id: I9f355f2af7b90022b01ad0bfbe7081d73dcc1416
Closes-Bug: #1752896

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-22 15:22:59.000000000', 'message': 'Update the database connection for keystone

1. the pymysql is needed for the current release[0]
2. it should use keystone_database_address rather than
keystone_service_ip, because they may different.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/keystone/templates/keystone.conf.j2#L22

Change-Id: I7eb90544bd6be167df157ca352ca01e21ce781bd
'}]
commit_message:
Update the database connection for keystone

1. the pymysql is needed for the current release[0]
2. it should use keystone_database_address rather than
keystone_service_ip, because they may different.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/keystone/templates/keystone.conf.j2#L22

Change-Id: I7eb90544bd6be167df157ca352ca01e21ce781bd

[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-23 14:58:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-23 18:59:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It's not clear why the lower-constraints job is failing but the py35 job is passing. I suspect some of the values in lower-constraints.txt are incorrect. Updating mistral-lib to 0.4.0 eliminates some of the errors about the unexpected argument "user_name" for example. It doesn't fix the errors from pecan saying that a function does not have an im_class attribute.

I would appreciate it if someone from the mistral team took this over and figured out what is going on.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-23 19:00:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-09 17:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-04-09 19:40:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-09 22:17:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-09 22:18:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-04-10 12:34:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-11 13:50:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-11 15:01:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-17 21:15:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-18 13:55:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-20 20:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

for more details.

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

Update the lower-bounds for a few dependencies to make the tests pass,
including eventlet and greenlet.

Remove the duplicate dependency on pecan.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I74c7cae0ceccd5aff77d5955c69ca842c598d633
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555402
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-19 18:59:23.000000000', 'message': "Doc config-download with deployed-server

Using config-download with deployed-server requires the use of a
HostnameMap since the configuration generated by Heat needs the hostname
value, and we can't know it until we use ansible to get the value.

A HostnameMap parameter value works around that limitation by explicitly
telling Heat what the hostname value is for each deployed-server.

Change-Id: Ie2f644a7d4b6ab8ec3eaefa138fd029c0a538a9c
"}]
commit_message:
Doc config-download with deployed-server

Using config-download with deployed-server requires the use of a
HostnameMap since the configuration generated by Heat needs the hostname
value, and we can't know it until we use ansible to get the value.

A HostnameMap parameter value works around that limitation by explicitly
telling Heat what the hostname value is for each deployed-server.

Change-Id: Ie2f644a7d4b6ab8ec3eaefa138fd029c0a538a9c

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-04-20 07:03:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

revoting as i spotted the pep8, not sure it is related as i saw this first http://logs.openstack.org/67/562867/2/check/openstack-tox-pep8/884fa2e/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-19_23_15_49_686540 but later there is this: http://logs.openstack.org/67/562867/2/check/openstack-tox-pep8/884fa2e/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-19_23_15_55_041025

2018-04-19 23:15:55.041025 | ubuntu-xenial | ERROR: The following network from network_data.yaml is missing or differs in ./network_data_ganesha.yaml : {'allocation_pools': [{'start': '10.0.1.4', 'end': '10.0.1.250'}], 'ipv6_allocation_pools': [{'start': 'fd00:fd00:fd00:6000::10', 'end': 'fd00:fd00:fd00:6000:ffff:ffff:ffff:fffe'}], 'vlan': 60, 'ip_subnet': '10.0.1.0/24', 'name_lower': 'management', 'ipv6_subnet': 'fd00:fd00:fd00:6000::/64', 'enabled': True, 'name': 'Management', 'vip': False}"}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2018-04-20 12:43:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-04-20 13:07:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-04-20 17:05:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I'm tempted to -2 this, it will have unintended consequences for the 90% of upgrades that *do not* use the Management network. We have a small minority of deployments that actually use the Management network, but this change will enable the Management network for everyone by default. Why not just add something to tripleo-validations that checks the already-deployed networks against network_data.yaml and errors out if the enabled networks do not match the deployment being upgraded?"}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-04-20 17:35:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I'm tempted to -2 this, it will have unintended consequences for
 > the 90% of upgrades that *do not* use the Management network. We
 > have a small minority of deployments that actually use the
 > Management network, but this change will enable the Management
 > network for everyone by default. Why not just add something to
 > tripleo-validations that checks the already-deployed networks
 > against network_data.yaml and errors out if the enabled networks do
 > not match the deployment being upgraded?

The main reason is to make the upgrade workflow smooth for the operator. In Newton the Management network could be enabled by passing the environments/network-management.yaml file. I expect that this doesn't change during upgrade. Right now the only way to move forward with the upgrade is to create a custom network_data.yaml, enable the management network inside and use it during upgrade. The downside for this approach is that the operator needs to manually maintain the custom network_data over time which could be error prone.

It is my understanding that when the Management network is not assigned to the roles in roles_data.yaml which is not with the default ones then it shouldn't get enabled. Please correct me if I am wrong.

Also in Pike the Management network was enabled by default:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/tree/network_data.yaml?h=stable/pike#n86"}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-04-20 17:50:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

After discussing with mcornea, he wants to backport this to Queens, which would keep more continuity between releases. I'm fine with that, but we need to update the network/config/README.md files to indicate that the Management network is already enabled, but that it needs to be either added to the roles in roles_data.yaml or the environments/network-management.yaml needs to be included in the deployment."}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-04-20 19:40:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-04-20 19:41:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> After discussing with mcornea, he wants to backport this to Queens,
 > which would keep more continuity between releases. I'm fine with
 > that, but we need to update the network/config/README.md files to
 > indicate that the Management network is already enabled, but that
 > it needs to be either added to the roles in roles_data.yaml or the
 > environments/network-management.yaml needs to be included in the
 > deployment.

Thanks for the feedback, Dan! I updated the README files to reflect this change."}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-04-23 09:59:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

> I'm tempted to -2 this, it will have unintended consequences for
 > the 90% of upgrades that *do not* use the Management network. We
 > have a small minority of deployments that actually use the
 > Management network, but this change will enable the Management
 > network for everyone by default. Why not just add something to
 > tripleo-validations that checks the already-deployed networks
 > against network_data.yaml and errors out if the enabled networks do
 > not match the deployment being upgraded?

I thought it would be enabled but not actually defined or used unless it is included by a Role in the roles_data.yaml?"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-04-23 10:01:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > I'm tempted to -2 this, it will have unintended consequences for
 > > the 90% of upgrades that *do not* use the Management network. We
 > > have a small minority of deployments that actually use the
 > > Management network, but this change will enable the Management
 > > network for everyone by default. Why not just add something to
 > > tripleo-validations that checks the already-deployed networks
 > > against network_data.yaml and errors out if the enabled networks
 > do
 > > not match the deployment being upgraded?
 > 
 > I thought it would be enabled but not actually defined or used
 > unless it is included by a Role in the roles_data.yaml?

sorry i saw the subsequent discussions and readme updates since v2 thanks"}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-04-23 11:40:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

mcornea++ dsneddon++ thanks guys'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-04-23 14:01:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 2c0029a1c096fad00b7a56e134cf20d4b8e83c6f'}]

commit_message:
Enable management network in network_data

This change enables the management network in network_data to allow
upgrading environments that were initially deployed with this optional
network enabled.

Change-Id: I39b1a70f0a27bdab4d6280d54107ff209d4bb67d
Closes-bug: 1765547

commit_message:
Add limit argument when servers list called in unittest

New nova client release break our unit test jobs. When list servers in unittest
with fake client, we will stuck in loop (because patch[1]) until job failed. Add
limit arguments when list servers in unit tests.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534222/7/novaclient/v2/servers.py

Change-Id: I42d4b087f3bbfde87b1050974023cd246937f243

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Additionally:
* remove lower constraint for oslo.config
* remove lower constraint and exclusion for reno

Change-Id: I187a6bd4eedcc139383efc25b6dbffe1c8cd39bc
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-24 09:58:00.000000000', 'message': 'OVO: Fix VolumeType create not bound to a Session

We have detected a spurious failure on unittest
QuotaIntegrationTestCase.test_too_many_volumes_of_type that presented as
a "not bound to a Session; lazy load operation" error for the "projects"
attribute of a Volume Type.

This is not an error on the tests but an error on the OVO-ORM mechanism
we have to create a VolumeType instance.

When we create a VolumeType we return created volume type as we have
sent it to the DB (not actually reading from the DB the current values)
so we don't have the "projects" field loaded in the ORM instance, which
means that SQLAlchemy will try to lazy load it when we get the project
value on the "_from_db_object".

There are 3 possible solutions to the problem:

- Read from the DB the VolumeType with the project list

- Change the way we do the db_type.get so we check against the
dictionary instead of the ORM object so we don't trigger the lazy
loading: `vars(db_type).get('projects', [])`

- On the "volume_type_create" method in the DB return the projects field
with the right values.

This patch implements the last 2 approaches as it fixes not only the
create case we are seeing right now, but also any other call to
VolumeType's _from_db_object that may be missing the projects field
because it was an empty list.

Change-Id: I6407c4b056922227b66f2231d1e1506cd6b7a36f
Closes-Bug: #1693090
'}, {'created': '2017-05-24 16:28:40.000000000', 'message': 'OVO: Fix VolumeType create not bound to a Session

We have detected a spurious failure on unittest
QuotaIntegrationTestCase.test_too_many_volumes_of_type that presented as
a "not bound to a Session; lazy load operation" error for the "projects"
attribute of a Volume Type.

This is not an error on the tests but an error on the OVO-ORM mechanism
we have to create a VolumeType instance.

When we create a VolumeType we return created volume type as we have
sent it to the DB (not actually reading from the DB the current values)
so we don't have the "projects" field loaded in the ORM instance, which
means that SQLAlchemy will try to lazy load it when we get the project
value on the "_from_db_object".

There are 3 possible solutions to the problem:

- Read from the DB the VolumeType with the project list

- Change the way we do the db_type.get so we check against the
dictionary instead of the ORM object so we don't trigger the lazy
loading: `vars(db_type).get('projects', [])`

- On the "volume_type_create" method in the DB return the projects field
with the right values.

This patch implements the last approach which fixes the VolumeType
creation issue.

In another patch we could address other potential cases where we could
be missing the project field as well, as mentioned in the second
approach, and that would require changing our fakes to use actual ORM
instances instead of dictionaries, and probably also adapting some
cinder code and additional tests.

Change-Id: I6407c4b056922227b66f2231d1e1506cd6b7a36f
Closes-Bug: #1693090
'}]
commit_message:
OVO: Fix VolumeType create not bound to a Session

We have detected a spurious failure on unittest
QuotaIntegrationTestCase.test_too_many_volumes_of_type that presented as
a "not bound to a Session; lazy load operation" error for the "projects"
attribute of a Volume Type.

This is not an error on the tests but an error on the OVO-ORM mechanism
we have to create a VolumeType instance.

When we create a VolumeType we return created volume type as we have
sent it to the DB (not actually reading from the DB the current values)
so we don't have the "projects" field loaded in the ORM instance, which
means that SQLAlchemy will try to lazy load it when we get the project
value on the "_from_db_object".

There are 3 possible solutions to the problem:

- Read from the DB the VolumeType with the project list

- Change the way we do the db_type.get so we check against the
dictionary instead of the ORM object so we don't trigger the lazy
loading: `vars(db_type).get('projects', [])`

- On the "volume_type_create" method in the DB return the projects field
with the right values.

This patch implements the last approach which fixes the VolumeType
creation issue.

In another patch we could address other potential cases where we could
be missing the project field as well, as mentioned in the second
approach, and that would require changing our fakes to use actual ORM
instances instead of dictionaries, and probably also adapting some
cinder code and additional tests.

Change-Id: I6407c4b056922227b66f2231d1e1506cd6b7a36f
Closes-Bug: #1693090

WIP: Do not use pip 10 or higher

packages[1]. This patch temporarily cap the version of pip to
work-around.

subject: Disable idempotence test
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-23 10:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/queens.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-23 10:53:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-04-23 12:55:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 10:51:59.000000000', 'message': "Disable idempotence test

The idempotence of the role doesn't really work properly
with the modern get-pip.py script.

Instead of porting [1] and [2] back along with other patches
which may have merged in master but are not in the stable
branch but may be necessary, we disable the idempotence check
instead.

This way we keep the stable branch stable, but ensure
idempotence properly from Rocky onwards.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/562243
[2] https://review.openstack.org/562188

Change-Id: Iaf0ef428f9c8a845e779770fb54fe62495326c4a
"}]
commit_message:
Disable idempotence test

The idempotence of the role doesn't really work properly
with the modern get-pip.py script.

Instead of porting [1] and [2] back along with other patches
which may have merged in master but are not in the stable
branch but may be necessary, we disable the idempotence check
instead.

This way we keep the stable branch stable, but ensure
idempotence properly from Rocky onwards.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/562243
[2] https://review.openstack.org/562188

Change-Id: Iaf0ef428f9c8a845e779770fb54fe62495326c4a

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I589a35f4ec9f322a6a0fb026a83f6c42bfc377f0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Enable sorting and pagination for segments

It looks the sorting and pagination are natively supported in
segment db layer but the segment controller doesn't mark these
features as supported. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I325396bb0256196ee6c6fc42cc812a0c75ae3827
Closes-Bug: #1763161

commit_message:
[newton only] Fix get-occ-config when some roles are not defined.

The check_stack currently fails when it encounters an role with not
stack:

   + return 0
   ++ heat resource-list overcloud
   ++ grep ' Compute '
   ++ awk '{print $4}'
   WARNING (shell) "heat resource-list" is deprecated, please use "openstack stack resource list" instead
   + rg_stack=
   + check_stack
   /home/centos/tripleo-heat-templates/deployed-server/scripts/get-occ-config.sh: line 26: $1: unbound variable

We can see that it fails on the empty Compute role.

This fix that error.

Now to avoid looping without end over non-existing role, we count the
number of host in each role and skip over those that are not expected.

This is not required in later version as the OVERCLOUD_ROLES variable
is passed to the script explicitly.

Change-Id: I551757031359ce1b3617d91841aae82030215350

commit_message:
DNM: Add debug and don't fail on validation for ffu.

Not sure we want to keep debug as it may be too verbose, and the
validation-errors-nonfatal should be optional.

Change-Id: Ie48316a021f8a1238c5d6fec801f0e22abcfde01

commit_message:
DNM: Testing FFU from queens branch.

We can't test ffu from master anymore, we need queens branch.

Tripleo-Quickstart, new featureset:
Depends-On: I240c087941a25227382548136898cb3b172d2389

CI mangling:
Depends-On: I043c52e8b537e65d00423aacfe8234fc80de216f

Deployed-Server patch in tht and fluentd:
Depends-On: I1d3ccd7d3fb641d187f214c20f1d6a4d6113304a

Change-Id: I03499c01386715da91abbd9e6aa9796f27a731c9

commit_message:
DNM: Testing P->Q from queens branch.

Testing temporarily on openstack infra.  First target though would be
rdo-cloud.  Using this jobs for test purpose only.

tripleo-ci mangling to get job in experimental (no really needed
anymore, but keep it for harder days)
Depends-On: I0843614a1fda84a46623d98317328bcea4ee42ed

Remove persistancy on update/upgrade prepare
Depends-On: I9db2c9256ed20d4d0b74bb467ee6ae0a9633bcc8

Change-Id: Idf1b611e36d3b5467a3578770ef73591ff88f754

[{'created': '2018-03-12 16:42:41.000000000', 'message': '[DNM]: Apply workaround for P->Q upgrades.

There are two issues at the time of upgrading
from Pike to Queens: one related to the service
name change from one release to another and other
with python-keystoneauth1 that needs to be
updated [0].

Appending this env file and removing keystoneauh1
workarounds it until both issues will get solved.

[0] - https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1533432

Change-Id: Iec3621ad4235e28ffd09f879b1a51db237817dd6

commit_message:
[DNM]: Apply workaround for P->Q upgrades.

There are two issues at the time of upgrading
from Pike to Queens: one related to the service
name change from one release to another and other
with python-keystoneauth1 that needs to be
updated [0].

Appending this env file and removing keystoneauh1
workarounds it until both issues will get solved.

[0] - https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1533432

Change-Id: Iec3621ad4235e28ffd09f879b1a51db237817dd6

'}, {'created': '2018-03-19 11:47:31.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Fix the multinode scenario job (spark)

Some changes are related to the way multinode works (after the final
bits have been settled during the PTG) and others are just bug fixes
that were not noticed before because the entire job did not work.
- switch to the orchestrate-devstack role as needed for multinode jobs;
  likewise, explicitly set the execution strategy to linear;
- remove few Swift related settings (services, a configuration
  variable) which are now set by default by devstack;
- increase the size of the default loop disk used by Swift
  and the maximum file size, otherwise the custom-built image
  will not fit;
- fix the variable which points to the sahara configuration
  file so that the the value set is injected in post-config;
- use devstack-admin credentials for now (in the future
  it may be devstack, but it may require more changes).
- remove the "voting: false" attribute because
  non-voting is implicit for experimental jobs.

Story: 2001686
Task: 8659

Change-Id: I51c1628f66beb827f3450f4432db8c985cd38f7f

'}, {'created': '2018-03-22 23:37:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the (experimental) multinode scenario job (spark)

Some changes are related to the way multinode works (after the final
bits have been settled during the PTG) and others are just bug fixes
that were not noticed before because the entire job did not work.
- switch to the orchestrate-devstack role as needed for multinode jobs;
  likewise, explicitly set the execution strategy to linear;
- remove few Swift related settings (services, a configuration
  variable) which are now set by default by devstack;
- increase the size of the default loop disk used by Swift
  and the maximum file size, otherwise the custom-built image
  will not fit;
- fix the variable which points to the sahara configuration
  file so that the the value set is injected in post-config;
- rework the creation of the custom flavor, and actually
  use the created flavor for the job;
- use devstack-admin credentials for now (in the future
  it may be devstack, but it may require more changes);
- remove the "voting: false" attribute because
  non-voting is implicit for experimental jobs.

commit_message:
Use Horizon UT framework

Let's use Horizon unit-tests framework where it's
possible to have better cross-project integration.

Related blueprint: improve-horizon-testing

Change-Id: Ibfe2c062c54563e2bd35410459be8b5c7b2d550e

Also it would be nice to make HTTP method complete.

commit_message:
Add the missing type for Health Monitor

According to the octavia api:
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/#health-monitor
there miss the 'HTTPS' and 'TLS-HELLO' types.
Also add the missing HTTP methods.

Change-Id: Ied278c3e178a2fe0a8ecc49aa6693505db06158f

commit_message:
fullstack: Simplify ConfigFixture

ConfigFixture composed ConfigFileFixture instead of inheritance. This
patch uses inheritance over composition in order to make
ConfigFileFixture attributes accesible from the outside.

Change-Id: I8c1c38245867111cb46c6f9493529ff3374593a0

[{'created': '2018-03-26 22:10:47.000000000', 'message': 'Automatically expire obsolete relationships

Listen for foreing key changes and expire related relationships.

With this, we can remove OVO code that refreshes / detaches models on
each fetch.

Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

'}, {'created': '2018-04-10 20:20:28.000000000', 'message': "Automatically expire obsolete relationships

Listen for foreign key changes and expire related relationships.

With this, we can remove OVO code that refreshes / detaches models on
each fetch. The patch also removes a bunch of expunge calls in plugin
code.

writer.using context manager is added to _get_subnets so that segment
plugin's _notify_subnet_updated handler that calls to _get_subnets
doesn't use the facade-less context.session that in specific cases may
cache old models from previous sessions when used in mixed
facade/facade-less environment.

Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

Co-Authored-By: Michael Bayer <mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com>
Change-Id: I18c6794f99d2847c208dfd6e9eb187d53b657a05

"}, {'created': '2018-04-11 20:30:14.000000000', 'message': "Automatically expire obsolete relationships

Listen for foreign key changes and expire related relationships.

With this, we can remove OVO code that refreshes / detaches models on
each fetch. The patch also removes a bunch of expunge calls in plugin
code.

writer.using context manager is added to _get_subnets so that segment
plugin's _notify_subnet_updated handler that calls to _get_subnets
doesn't use the facade-less context.session that in specific cases may
cache old models from previous sessions when used in mixed
facade/facade-less environment.

This patch bumps SQLAlchemy minimal requirement to >= 1.1.0 because
pending_to_persistent event didn't exist before this version.

"}, {'created': '2018-04-16 21:10:31.000000000', 'message': "Automatically expire obsolete relationships

Listen for foreign key changes and expire related relationships.

With this, we can remove OVO code that refreshes / detaches models on
each fetch. The patch also removes a bunch of expunge calls in plugin
code.

writer.using context manager is added to _get_subnets so that segment
plugin's _notify_subnet_updated handler that calls to _get_subnets
doesn't use the facade-less context.session that in specific cases may
cache old models from previous sessions when used in mixed
facade/facade-less environment.

This patch bumps SQLAlchemy minimal requirement to >= 1.2.0 because
pending_to_persistent event didn't exist before this version. It could be >=
1.1.0 if not for the fact that all 1.1.x releases have a bug that results in
breakage of test_update_with_none_and_own_mac_for_duplicate_ip due to obscure
import ordering issue in the library.

(The issue is fixed by https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/commit/
63ff0140705207198545e3a0d7868a5ba8486e93)

Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

Co-Authored-By: Michael Bayer <mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com>
Change-Id: I18c6794f99d2847c208dfd6e9eb187d53b657a05

plugin's _notify_subnet_updated handler that calls to _get_subnets
doesn't use the facade-less context.session that in specific cases may
cache old models from previous sessions when used in mixed
facade/facade-less environment.

This patch bumps SQLAlchemy minimal requirement to >= 1.2.0 because
pending_to_persistent event didn't exist before this version. It could be >=
1.1.0 if not for the fact that all 1.1.x releases have a bug that results in
breakage of test_update_with_none_and_own_mac_for_duplicate_ip due to obscure
import ordering issue in the library.

(The issue is fixed by https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/commit/
63ff0140705207198545e3a0d7868a5ba8486e93)

Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

Co-Authored-By: Michael Bayer <mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com>
Change-Id: I18c6794f99d2847c208dfd6e9eb187d53b657a05
"}]
commit_message:
Automatically expire obsolete relationships

Listen for foreign key changes and expire related relationships.

With this, we can remove OVO code that refreshes / detaches models on
each fetch. The patch also removes a bunch of expunge calls in plugin
code.

writer.using context manager is added to _get_subnets so that segment
plugin's _notify_subnet_updated handler that calls to _get_subnets
doesn't use the facade-less context.session that in specific cases may
cache old models from previous sessions when used in mixed
facade/facade-less environment.

This patch bumps SQLAlchemy minimal requirement to >= 1.2.0 because
pending_to_persistent event didn't exist before this version. It could be >=
1.1.0 if not for the fact that all 1.1.x releases have a bug that results in
breakage of test_update_with_none_and_own_mac_for_duplicate_ip due to obscure
import ordering issue in the library.

(The issue is fixed by https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/commit/
63ff0140705207198545e3a0d7868a5ba8486e93)

Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

Co-Authored-By: Michael Bayer <mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com>
Change-Id: I18c6794f99d2847c208dfd6e9eb187d53b657a05

commit_message:
Add pip_install_options to pip install tasks

To ensure that proxies and other required settings
for a deployment can be passed through to pip install
as they are with all other roles, we ensure that the
extra options are included.

Change-Id: Iddd8c530c8c3e3cbd4290b765a79ebee9b416e42

commit_message:
Constrain the pip/setuptools/wheel versions in the venvs

The installation of these packages are currently not constrained,
resulting in inconsistent experiences at deploy time.

This patch ensures that the venv preparation process properly
constrains the installation so that results are consistent.

Change-Id: I744e43d8a1b85d5bdaf7019a6420a39222911330
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 30ac05c5b02dcf4fa2350cf52298c7ca312fb342)

commit_message:
Support version for execution creation

Now, all the underlying resources(pod, service) in k8s cluster have
version number in their labels. Different versions of the same function
will have different services exposed in k8s cluster.

Change-Id: Ic0b3045404105175073844b908fa0f6c2ef2ab8a
Story: #2001829
Task: #14350

commit_message:
Lint directory instead of files and match exclude from oooq-extra.

Linting the directory leads to different result, with a lot more
errors caught.

As a corollary adjust the lint exclude list to match the oooq extra
exclude list.

Change-Id: I4846fb4f4bda29d991e4e36de38dc10f02bcd4ed
Related-Bug: #1764454

commit_message:
api-ref: document sorting parameters for security

API users can use the 'sort_key' and 'sort_dir' to do the sorting
on list result. This patch add documentation of these two parameters
for l2 networking resources, including rbac policy, security group
and security group rule.

Change-Id: I985734e7f7bed56aabd8420f46dec2aa25958e02
Partial-Bug: #1749024

commit_message:

API users can use the 'sort_key' and 'sort_dir' to do the sorting
on list result. This patch add documentation of these two parameters
for l3 networking resources, including floatingip, router, subnet,
and subnetpool.

Partial-Bug: #1749024

[{'created': '2018-04-20 14:13:49.000000000', 'message': 'Disallow SSLv2, SSLv3 and TLS1.0 in httpd for FedRAMP compliance.

We now enforce TLS1.1 or higher for httpd connections, to meet the

commit_message:
Disallow SSLv2, SSLv3 and TLS1.0 in httpd for FedRAMP compliance.

We now enforce TLS1.1 or higher for httpd connections, to meet the
requirements for FedRAMP.

Change-Id: If875822f1cb705d17405621e64fea2536edc142a
Related-Bug: #1754368
(cherry picked from commit 1b54e4b5a72446cd92042485a48cb82cc451a475)

commit_message:
Revert "Fix neutron-plugin-ml2.yaml puppet base ref"

This reverts commit 70ccf2120e2cc863966bde2ff7227ec69c6ec5b5.

This breaks scenarios where OS::TripleO::Docker::NeutronMl2PluginBase is overridden like ovn, odl, etc.

Closes-Bug: #1765975

[{'created': '2018-04-17 17:04:22.000000000', 'message': 'Use oslo-config-generator for keystone config

The configue_keystone function was relying on a sample configuration
file being provided by keystone source. The sample file is usually
out-of-date and requires constant maintenance in order to be accurate.
Instead of relying on a sample in the source tree, we can just
generate a sample configuration file from the in-code configuration
module that keystone has.

Change-Id: I7a1f879e9e242a11e2c4663ec116e33da28db7f5
'}, {'created': '2018-04-18 19:53:56.000000000', 'message': "Remove the sample configuration file for keystone

This commit just makes sure that the configuration file for keystone
exists on the system. We use iniset to actually populate the values
we want before we run keystone anyway.

This results in a cleaner configuration file that isn't bloated with
comments and help text.

Change-Id: I7a1f879e9e242a11e2c4663ec116e33da28db7f5

Change-Id: I7a1f879e9e242a11e2c4663ec116e33da28db7f5
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the sample configuration file for keystone

This commit just makes sure that the configuration file for keystone
exists on the system. We use iniset to actually populate the values
we want before we run keystone anyway.

This results in a cleaner configuration file that isn't bloated with
comments and help text.

Change-Id: I7a1f879e9e242a11e2c4663ec116e33da28db7f5

commit_message:
Ensure that pip.conf templates variables properly

When a user provides values other than the defaults for
upgrade/pre, they may not format it in a way that pip
interprets properly. To ensure that we template the
conf file correctly, we ensure that it's interpreted
as a boolean, then make it lower case as is expected by
pip.

Change-Id: I91590665cd2d878b6b5ef92d1118610bb4a3fd84

commit_message:
bootstrap-host: Set repo build pip default mirror when in openstack-ci

When in openstack-ci we should use the most local pypi mirror
available for the repo build process to speed things up.

Change-Id: I9e6c209bafa21afe22e0c4f67da584d553a50e00

commit_message:
Disable mox usage by default in test helper

- Add use_mox = True to tests which still depend on mox
- Remove use_mox = False from all tests converted into mock
- Update the warning messages
- Replace 'S'-release with 'Stein'

Part of blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests
Change-Id: I208185e97b2de346304a09643a9cb3f1425a7683
Signed-off-by: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

commit_message:

Ceph: Fix config helper image and bump version

This PS adds the ceph-clients to the config helper image, which
were previously missed and also bumps the version used.

commit_message:
Avoid mixing pip and distribution packages.

The hosts may end up in a rather messed up state when mixing
distribution and pip packages. The python lxc bindings are already
provided in the distro repositories so we can simply use these in order
to keep the host as clean as possible.

Change-Id: Ia370f393b961b453ad60e5539f5027d19bf4281f
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

[{'created': '2018-04-16 13:10:27.000000000', 'message': 'cleanup attribute leftovers that are not used anymore

* removed all unused attributes
* removed vmware specific configuration option that can be set in a
wrapper cookbook (and was not maintained for quite some time)
* removed caseswitch for nova user and group since we currently only
support debian and rhel
* moved all libvirtd related config options to specific attribute file
in preparation for further refactoring

Change-Id: I42a0bbcd03a570b9d6d24ba32ed2cafacc33ec76
'}]
commit_message:
cleanup attribute leftovers that are not used anymore

* removed all unused attributes
* removed vmware specific configuration option that can be set in a
wrapper cookbook (and was not maintained for quite some time)
* removed caseswitch for nova user and group since we currently only
support debian and rhel
* moved all libvirtd related config options to specific attribute file
in preparation for further refactoring

Change-Id: I42a0bbcd03a570b9d6d24ba32ed2cafacc33ec76

commit_message:
Add the service_config_settings from {{service-name}} base

Some container yaml file does not get the
service_config_settings from the base file.

This patch makes for the following docker yaml files get
the service_config_settings:
 docker/services/neutron-l3.yaml
 docker/services/neutron-metadata.yaml
 docker/services/neutron-ovs-agent.yaml

Related-Bug: #1757066

Change-Id: Ifc8def10da0b10decd12efaab4452ff46f3c685b

[{'created': '2018-03-20 15:38:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add the service_config_settings from nova-compute base

The docker nova-compute.yaml file does not have the
service_config_settings from the base file. So the
collectd and fluentd parameters defined are not got
when the service run containerized.

The patch get the service_config_settings from the base file and
use it on the when is containerized.

Closes-Bug: #1757066
Change-Id: I0b3567edd7530d1ae0a69d3ee25bd1442f14fb58
'}]
commit_message:
Add the service_config_settings from nova-compute base

The docker nova-compute.yaml file does not have the
service_config_settings from the base file. So the
collectd and fluentd parameters defined are not got
when the service run containerized.

The patch get the service_config_settings from the base file and
use it on the when is containerized.

Closes-Bug: #1757066
Change-Id: I0b3567edd7530d1ae0a69d3ee25bd1442f14fb58

[{'created': '2018-04-02 22:19:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix limits show command without Nova and Cinder

This patch implements an endpoint lookup when showing limits. This
addresses the issue when showing limits without both Nova and Cinder

commit_message:
Fix limits show command without Nova and Cinder

This patch implements an endpoint lookup when showing limits. This
addresses the issue when showing limits without both Nova and Cinder
and will display limits if one is missing.

Change-Id: I2214b281e0206f8fe117aae52de2bf4c4e2c6525
Closes-bug: #1707960

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints job

* update requirements from global-requirements
* move common commands to [testenv]
* bump monasca-statsd to 1.4.0 which is the first version with Python 3
  support
* add funcsigs, Jinja2 and jira to lower-constraints.txt

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/562151
Change-Id: I427dd136b385f8784e6d16b174dcadf3ffa555a7

(7 comments)

Content looks good and I think it would be useful to contributors on both other open sources using a different SSH key pair and OpenStack.

My comments just focus on a term of SSH key pair and SSH keys, assuming the followings, since I think the reader will create a SSH private key & corresponding public key, not multiple SSH key pairs, but they might not be my strong opinion:

- A SSH key pair consists of a private SSH key and corresponding public SSH key.
- SSH keys would refer any set of SSH keys: a pair of private & public keys, pairs or SSH keys, and so on.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-04-19 02:19:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Add precheck for haproxy certificate file

If user enables TLS it also is necessary to create
a certificate. This precheck ensures the certificate
file exists before starting deployment.

Change-Id: I772d52e228ed012b9f8ccb5b616f9b188d3d340c
Closes-Bug: #1765677

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-15 10:16:15.000000000', 'message': 'Adding WWW-Authenticate info.

Sometimes when mistral requests are failing with "401 Unauthorized"
against keycloak, the reason are not mentioned in the logs.

In case keycloack return 401 it must provide the www-Authenticate
response header with the reason:
https://www.w3.org/Protocols/HTTP/1.0/spec.html#WWW-Authenticate

This code take care of it by adding the WWW-Authenticate value to
mistral api-log.

Change-Id: I7ae221aaeb2233184bd4818490e72ff662dca5cb
Closes-Bug: #1737500
(cherry picked from commit 1ece440ac5f4b613385b44623022421a60256bc7)
'}]
commit_message:
Adding WWW-Authenticate info.

Sometimes when mistral requests are failing with "401 Unauthorized"
against keycloak, the reason are not mentioned in the logs.

In case keycloack return 401 it must provide the www-Authenticate
response header with the reason:
https://www.w3.org/Protocols/HTTP/1.0/spec.html#WWW-Authenticate

This code take care of it by adding the WWW-Authenticate value to
mistral api-log.

Change-Id: I7ae221aaeb2233184bd4818490e72ff662dca5cb
Closes-Bug: #1737500
(cherry picked from commit 1ece440ac5f4b613385b44623022421a60256bc7)

commit_message:
Allow pypiserver to be upgraded before repo build

To cater for a situation where the pypiserver package is changing,
but the repo does not yet have the package built, we need to ensure
that the install task for it can fetch from pypi (or the designated
pypi mirror). To do this we try the local repo first, then fall back
to using the designated default index which defaults to pypi.

Change-Id: I1a2d36793fccc4c50f00247c8d19501ad8816517

[{'created': '2018-04-20 13:26:37.000000000', 'message': "Override the default index for the wheel build

When doing the wheel build we need to ensure that we make
use of the pypi mirror directly.

When upgrading, if we leave it to the pip.conf file contents,
it will only use the contents of the pypiserver which locks
it down to the wheels built for the version we're upgrading
from. The wheel build therefore fails.

Leaving the pip.conf config in place is still good for
ensuring that anything installed on the repo server later uses
the pypiserver contents.

Change-Id: I5d1f33832c9738683b49384ea5ebfb571b526a81
"}, {'created': '2018-04-20 13:27:01.000000000', 'message': "Override the pip index used for the wheel build

use of the pypi mirror directly.

When upgrading, if we leave it to the pip.conf file contents,
it will only use the contents of the pypiserver which locks
it down to the wheels built for the version we're upgrading
from. The wheel build therefore fails.

Leaving the pip.conf config in place is still good for
ensuring that anything installed on the repo server later uses
the pypiserver contents.

Change-Id: I5d1f33832c9738683b49384ea5ebfb571b526a81
"}]
commit_message:
Override the pip index used for the wheel build

When doing the wheel build we need to ensure that we make
use of the pypi mirror directly.

When upgrading, if we leave it to the pip.conf file contents,
it will only use the contents of the pypiserver which locks
it down to the wheels built for the version we're upgrading
from. The wheel build therefore fails.

Leaving the pip.conf config in place is still good for
ensuring that anything installed on the repo server later uses
the pypiserver contents.

Change-Id: I5d1f33832c9738683b49384ea5ebfb571b526a81

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I9205f5f3183eff8059e7589b6a3a2bbf36f8b60a
Partial-Bug: #1764470

commit_message:
Only update plan on upgrade converge

The intention for Queens+ is to upgrade Ceph in a separate step, out
of the main upgrade workflow. This approach would break if we do an
actual Heat stack update during converge, we should only update the
plan.

Change-Id: I503c5aa548d9d3b5a10eb329272d4a3eac90695b
Closes-Bug: #1764996

commit_message:
[RBAC] Fix setting network as not shared

In case when network was shared with specified project
by RBAC rule and it was also set as "shared" there was
a bug which forbid to set such network as not shared even
if only projects which still used network was owner and
project with specified RBAC rule.

This patch fixes it by adding additional check in
NeutronDbPluginV2._validate_shared_update() in such case.

Change-Id: I6ab05a8f0ece454f5bef8ba978af05f5fa1354d8
Closes-Bug: #1764330

Hi Sam, 

Thank you for the comment. When an instance is deployed, instance boot is prepared in the end of deployment. A method for this preparation doesn't belong to a deploy interface but to HeartBeatMixIn and the method differs between deploy interfaces (direct[1], iscsi[2], and ansible[3]). That's why I add a separated method for unresuce to deploy interface.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/drivers/modules/agent.py#L262
[2] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/drivers/modules/iscsi_deploy.py#L390

I don't quite agree with bypassing the boot interface. If our prepare_instance is not doing what it should, I suggest we fix it. E.g. now PXEBoot.prepare_instance does inspect is_whole_disk_image, but does it at a wrong place. I think this detection of boot_option https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py#L588 should take is_whole_disk_image into account."}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-03-13 12:05:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

> I don't quite agree with bypassing the boot interface. If our

Agent deploy not calling prepare instance is actually an open bug that has been identified and there are patches to fix it here https://review.openstack.org/#/c/499050/

I'd really don't want us to make poor design decisions for new features based on bugged code..."}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2018-03-13 12:23:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Dmitry: In the past it was decided that PXE boot interface would always perform PXE boot even for the whole disk images using chainloading of bootloaders. It would perform the disk boot only if the 'boot_option' is specified as 'local'."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-03-13 12:27:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Sure. It would be better to land this patch[1] for the older bug.
