revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 08:33:25.000000000', 'message': 'Set boot device to disk to unrescue node with whole disk image

The boot device is set to PXE to rescue a node. If a node is deployed
with a whole disk image, the node should be booted from its disk after
unrescued.

This patch sets the boot device to disk at unrescuing if a whole disk
image is used.

Change-Id: I061cbe37cc98d189902691f6c29aa27fd5fe8901
Closes-Bug: 1750958
'}, {'created': '2018-02-22 10:33:38.000000000', 'message': "Set boot device to disk for whole disk image

PXEBoot.prepare_instance() prepares PXE boot even if a whole disk image
is used. Due to this issue, a node cannot be booted at unrescuing
because the boot device is not set to 'disk'.

This patch fixes this method to set a boot device to 'disk' when a
whole disk image is used.

Closes-Bug: 1750958
Change-Id: I061cbe37cc98d189902691f6c29aa27fd5fe8901
"}, {'created': '2018-03-03 21:38:57.000000000', 'message': "Prepare instance to unrescue by deploy interface

To unrescue a node, it is necessary to prepare to boot the node with
a user image as the node is deployed. This preparation depends on a
deploy interface as well as a boot interface. For example, when a whole
disk image is used, 'direct' deploy interface sets the boot device to
'disk' regardless of boot option, while 'iscsi' deploy interface calls
boot.prepare_instance(), which may see boot option. So, just calling
boot.prepare_instance() is not enough for unrescuing a node.

This patch adds prepare_instance_to_unrescue() method to deploy
interface. This method calls boot.prepare_instance() by default as
AgentRescue.unrescue() used to do. 'direct' deploy interface sets the
boot device to 'disk' for a whole disk image in this method because
the boot device may be changed to boot a rescue ramdisk at rescuing.
'ansible' deploy interface always sets the  boot device to 'disk'.

Closes-Bug: 1750958
Change-Id: I061cbe37cc98d189902691f6c29aa27fd5fe8901
"}, {'created': '2018-03-07 02:40:14.000000000', 'message': "Prepare instance to unrescue by deploy interface

To unrescue a node, it is necessary to prepare to boot the node with
a user image as the node is deployed. This preparation depends on a
deploy interface as well as a boot interface. For example, when a whole
disk image is used, 'direct' deploy interface sets the boot device to
'disk' regardless of boot option, while 'iscsi' deploy interface calls
boot.prepare_instance(), which may see boot option. So, just calling
boot.prepare_instance() is not enough for unrescuing a node.

This patch adds prepare_instance_to_unrescue() method to deploy
interface. This method calls boot.prepare_instance() by default as
AgentRescue.unrescue() used to do. 'direct' deploy interface sets the
boot device to 'disk' for a whole disk image in this method because
the boot device may be changed to boot a rescue ramdisk at rescuing.
'ansible' deploy interface always sets the  boot device to 'disk'.

Closes-Bug: 1750958
Change-Id: I061cbe37cc98d189902691f6c29aa27fd5fe8901
"}]
commit_message:
Prepare instance to unrescue by deploy interface

To unrescue a node, it is necessary to prepare to boot the node with
a user image as the node is deployed. This preparation depends on a
deploy interface as well as a boot interface. For example, when a whole
disk image is used, 'direct' deploy interface sets the boot device to
'disk' regardless of boot option, while 'iscsi' deploy interface calls
boot.prepare_instance(), which may see boot option. So, just calling
boot.prepare_instance() is not enough for unrescuing a node.

This patch adds prepare_instance_to_unrescue() method to deploy
interface. This method calls boot.prepare_instance() by default as
AgentRescue.unrescue() used to do. 'direct' deploy interface sets the
boot device to 'disk' for a whole disk image in this method because
the boot device may be changed to boot a rescue ramdisk at rescuing.
'ansible' deploy interface always sets the  boot device to 'disk'.

Closes-Bug: 1750958
Change-Id: I061cbe37cc98d189902691f6c29aa27fd5fe8901

commit_message:
Add support for use of bridges for data ports

Inline with neutron-openvswitch add support for use of existing
linuxbridge's when wiring openvswitch bridges to underlying
network devices.

Change-Id: I24281e8c31d9a140dfdaff308e6e99d3ce162fef
Closes-Bug: 1635067

commit_message:
Pass environment files to upgrade converge step.

We stop persist env files and the most safest option
is to pass all the env files used during initial deployment
to the 'upgrade converge' command.

Change-Id: Ia47293e1a3e1323a5a8801bf564fad529329d015

commit_message:
Spec of subscription filtering tags support

By default, a subscriber of zaqar topic receives every message published
to the topic. To receive only a subset of the messages, a subscriber
assigns a filter policy to the topic subscription. So in this case,
zaqar need to support message filtering

Change-Id: I55e39c1eb403fc4d6287c3a54de3a46fd96fa7e1
blueprint: subscription-filtering-tags

commit_message:
Revert "Operator for start/end_timestamp changes to 'eq'"

This reverts commit b540674a84b096d3df7dfaf8004c5f6bfa4adcc1.

This changes is wrong in the sense as it removes the ability to filter via ge/le the start and end timestamps.

Change-Id: I0c82917a6fd6795266e34b4d151faf13f43ab5bb

commit_message:
Fix functional job failed

After Neutron patch I3c93818002c2d7753454547231ba08544b6fa1c0 merged,
the default value of segment description is an empty string.

This patch will determine whether the Neuron shim extension
standard-attr-segment supported.

Change-Id: I68a3c018f03e5bb53bd637844ac9d7742a765db0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-19 17:27:16.000000000', 'message': 'Allow live_migration_inbound_addr to be used with non-default port/user/extra_params

live_migration_scheme was being used when live_migration_inbound_addr was set.
This prohibits a non-default port/user/extra_params being used, which is often
required to fully describe the uri, particularly for the ssh transport
(see bug#1671288).

However live_migration_inbound_addr also works with live_migration_uri, so for
now revert back to using live_migration_uri in all cases.

Change-Id: Ifdc5fbd05195604ab6ea6564d0905f9385c6df67
Closes-Bug: #1765462
'}]
commit_message:
Allow live_migration_inbound_addr to be used with non-default port/user/extra_params

live_migration_scheme was being used when live_migration_inbound_addr was set.
This prohibits a non-default port/user/extra_params being used, which is often
required to fully describe the uri, particularly for the ssh transport
(see bug#1671288).

However live_migration_inbound_addr also works with live_migration_uri, so for
now revert back to using live_migration_uri in all cases.

Change-Id: Ifdc5fbd05195604ab6ea6564d0905f9385c6df67
Closes-Bug: #1765462

commit_message:
Handle libvirt/cpu_model_extra_flags option

This allows for specifying granular CPU feature flags when specifying
CPU models.
It should be set only if 'cpu_mode' and 'cpu_model' attributes are set
and cpu_mode attribute value is set to "custom".

NOTE: The related nova changes are done in change:
I6bb956808aa3df58747c865c92e5b276e61aff44

Change-Id: Id4f2cad2e0b0c34a7a68d0b3a6f69b44816f4cd9
(cherry picked from commit c12e3580287911a355de8bdf2fdd4c37c38d7fec)

commit_message:
Handle libvirt/cpu_model_extra_flags option

This allows for specifying granular CPU feature flags when specifying
CPU models.
It should be set only if 'cpu_mode' and 'cpu_model' attributes are set
and cpu_mode attribute value is set to "custom".

NOTE: The related nova changes are done in change:
I6bb956808aa3df58747c865c92e5b276e61aff44

Change-Id: Id4f2cad2e0b0c34a7a68d0b3a6f69b44816f4cd9
(cherry picked from commit c12e3580287911a355de8bdf2fdd4c37c38d7fec)

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Also adjust lower_contstraints.txt to match requirements.txt and
test_requirements.txt so that the requirements job will pass.

Change-Id: Ib1d74405c239f0a7d62f327a3aad6a9c8fd549e7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Also adjust lower_contstraints.txt to match requirements.txt and
test_requirements.txt so that the requirements job will pass.

Change-Id: Ib1d74405c239f0a7d62f327a3aad6a9c8fd549e7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Update the requirement for tripleo-common to reflect reality, and update
the constraint for tenaciy.

Change-Id: Ifdf8dd1c782d6d6ac575d6fd5364dcb083e805a9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Stop gnocchi during unstack

since it is ceilometer's devstack plugin who enables/starts gnocchi
services, it is appropriate to also stop them during unstack phase.

Change-Id: I97747a98ddb139a6f89fa54b4d17e0ca1d1bdf62

commit_message:
Add task to create volumes path in cephfs

If using the cephfs native backend, when container start the
manila-share process with the manila user, no permissions are
prompted when creating the volume.
One way to solve the problem is to create the volumes folder in
advance in cephfs and modify the owner and group to 42429:42429,
which is manila's uid and gid.

Change-Id: I1ad63e1c4698ec8ee83461aafefa63041cfeb387
Closes-Bug: #1761108

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 05:17:00.000000000', 'message': 'pip-and-virtualenv: fix install-pip when centos-release-openstack is enabled

When RDO projects repository is installed, the python-setuptools package
is obsoleted by python2-setuptools, this makes the install-pip script failed:

Package python-setuptools-0.9.8-7.el7.noarch is obsoleted by python2-setuptools-22.0.5-1.el7.noarch which is already installed
Then the "rpm -ql python-setuptools | xargs rm -rf" exit 1

Change-Id: I2b0051bd9e81908c187098a7b82e120b999b111d
'}, {'created': '2018-04-20 05:18:43.000000000', 'message': 'pip-and-virtualenv: fix install-pip when centos-release-openstack is enabled

Then the "rpm -ql python-setuptools | xargs rm -rf" exit 1

Change-Id: I2b0051bd9e81908c187098a7b82e120b999b111d
'}, {'created': '2018-04-20 07:03:53.000000000', 'message': 'pip-and-virtualenv: fix install-pip when centos-release-openstack is enabled

When RDO projects repository is installed, the python-setuptools package
is obsoleted by python2-setuptools, this makes the install-pip script failed:

Package python-setuptools-0.9.8-7.el7.noarch is obsoleted by python2-setuptools-22.0.5-1.el7.noarch which is already installed
Then the "rpm -ql python-setuptools | xargs rm -rf" exit 1

Change-Id: I2b0051bd9e81908c187098a7b82e120b999b111d
'}, {'created': '2018-04-22 22:19:34.000000000', 'message': 'pip-and-virtualenv: fix install-pip when centos-release-openstack is enabled

When RDO projects repository is installed, the python-setuptools
package is obsoleted by python2-setuptools, this makes the install-pip
script failed:

  Package python-setuptools-0.9.8-7.el7.noarch is obsoleted by
  python2-setuptools-22.0.5-1.el7.noarch which is already installed

Then the "rpm -ql python-setuptools | xargs rm -rf" exit 1.  Check if
we have a record of the updated package obsoleting then old one; if
so, use it.

Change-Id: I2b0051bd9e81908c187098a7b82e120b999b111d
'}]
commit_message:
pip-and-virtualenv: fix install-pip when centos-release-openstack is enabled

When RDO projects repository is installed, the python-setuptools
package is obsoleted by python2-setuptools, this makes the install-pip
script failed:

  Package python-setuptools-0.9.8-7.el7.noarch is obsoleted by
  python2-setuptools-22.0.5-1.el7.noarch which is already installed

Then the "rpm -ql python-setuptools | xargs rm -rf" exit 1.  Check if
we have a record of the updated package obsoleting then old one; if
so, use it.

Change-Id: I2b0051bd9e81908c187098a7b82e120b999b111d

commit_message:
Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

Change-Id: I80b1cfd20e013ef89eb9f64b38f9ee083f600e81
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add bindep.txt file

Bindep is a tool for checking the presence of binary packages needed
to use an application / library. It started life as a way to make it
easier to set up a development environment for OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Id58d5e1ff4a2a9a2ace474cf3f4ed949737ec823
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

Change-Id: I1b3ba354b40c55b4dfaa3561213f93a506cdd1d7
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 21:00:03.000000000', 'message': "Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Ic69473a9723df59d0a3a93fb3a8209d59fe1c6b6
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 1085b03ec5e56f1ad1b75fd0db3c618272b217fa)
"}]
commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Ic69473a9723df59d0a3a93fb3a8209d59fe1c6b6
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 1085b03ec5e56f1ad1b75fd0db3c618272b217fa)

commit_message:
Configure Keystone to get a list of all HAproxy instances

This will allow Keystone to be able to put the correct IP address
in the logs using the X-Forwarded-For headers.

Depends-On: I9006dbb15837178cee7de869372c901040095e2b
Change-Id: Ic439514885edf6e63f94172943a0424e3c3a9fbf

subject: Freeze the networking-odl repo from SHA bumps
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-20 14:00:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-20 14:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-04-22 13:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 14:00:42.000000000', 'message': 'Freeze the networking-odl repo from SHA bumps

The networking-old repo now has ceilometer in its requirements
file - without a SHA/version pin, just for a fun way to wreak
havoc.

To prevent this havoc from affecting OpenStack-Ansible builds,
we note that the repo is frozen and why.

Change-Id: I86bf3a3c93a0f1a97fafd1f3f09b76943d3f3494
'}]
commit_message:
Freeze the networking-odl repo from SHA bumps

The networking-old repo now has ceilometer in its requirements
file - without a SHA/version pin, just for a fun way to wreak
havoc.

To prevent this havoc from affecting OpenStack-Ansible builds,
we note that the repo is frozen and why.

Change-Id: I86bf3a3c93a0f1a97fafd1f3f09b76943d3f3494

subject: Fix delegation to hosts not in inventory
messages:
[{'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-03-08 02:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-03-08 02:08:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Here's an example of where delegation is currently breaking:
http://logs.openstack.org/14/501814/36/check/openstack-ansible-deploy-ceph-ubuntu-xenial/f54b93d/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-02-28_09_14_36_939770


https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-ceph_client/blob/master/tasks/ceph_config.yml#L24-L31

This task delegates from a glance container to the IP address of a ceph mon host. The ceph mon host is another container in the gate test, but since the delegation references only the IP address, its hostvars aren't looked up. It's failing because the glance container's 'container_name' and 'physical_host' are cached and being used by the connection plugin, effectively not delegating at all."}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-03-08 04:03:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-03-08 04:04:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Fix delegation to hosts not in inventory

When using Ansible 2.5, delegation of a task from a container to a host
that is not mentioned in the inventory is currently broken.

The connection plugin works by comparing the host vars 'container_name'
and 'physical_host' to determine if a target host is a container. Both
of these variables are specific to hosts within an OSA generated
inventory. When delegating to a host outside of the inventory however,
the variables will remain cached from the originating host, so a task
wouldn't actually delegate at all.

This is fixed by checking that the 'inventory_hostname' is the same as
the 'container_name'.

Change-Id: I69f2eed35859bdc149e5ed21441eab7c8a8352cf

[{'created': '2018-04-20 20:53:36.000000000', 'message': 'Remove double warning from run-upgrade

The reality is that the upgrade script is always in
development, as is all open source software. Instead
of having this extra warning we just have one which
provides a suitable warning to use this in a test
environment first.

Also, we remove the set -v because the output of the
whole script is not very helpful when executing or
debugging.

Change-Id: I8e23bfacf131a0c7d5c3716437dbfecb896bbb70
(cherry picked from commit 82d618d7901ac9ce50b0bbc23641290e77340a56)

commit_message:
Remove double warning from run-upgrade

The reality is that the upgrade script is always in
development, as is all open source software. Instead
of having this extra warning we just have one which
provides a suitable warning to use this in a test
environment first.

Also, we remove the set -v because the output of the
whole script is not very helpful when executing or
debugging.

Change-Id: I8e23bfacf131a0c7d5c3716437dbfecb896bbb70
(cherry picked from commit 82d618d7901ac9ce50b0bbc23641290e77340a56)

commit_message:
Remove tempest_git_* overrides

Presently, tempest in the integrated build is installed from PyPI, but without
constraints. This means the version installed may not be what is expected (as
we're currently seeing in the stable/pike branch).

This commit removes the tempest_git_* overrides from
playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_testing.yml, which results in
tempest getting installed from PyPI but with constraints applied.

Conflicts:
    playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_testing.yml

Change-Id: I014201129b4d6b47ec45ff6239287623123a1595
(cherry picked from commit 61e8553ae3fda9cded6acafcf0fa4861b1d3e0bd)

commit_message:
Remove tempest_git_* overrides

Presently, tempest in the integrated build is installed from PyPI, but without
constraints. This means the version installed may not be what is expected (as
we're currently seeing in the stable/pike branch).

This commit removes the tempest_git_* overrides from
playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_testing.yml, which results in
tempest getting installed from PyPI but with constraints applied.

Conflicts:
    playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_testing.yml

Change-Id: I014201129b4d6b47ec45ff6239287623123a1595
(cherry picked from commit 61e8553ae3fda9cded6acafcf0fa4861b1d3e0bd)

subject: Added monitoring tag to monitoring user creation task.
messages: [{'account_id': 11290, 'date': '2018-04-20 14:31:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/pike.'}, {'account_id': 2928, 'date': '2018-04-20 15:54:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-20 16:16:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-04-22 13:09:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 14:31:19.000000000', 'message': "Added monitoring tag to monitoring user creation task.

Without that tag, the monitoring user doesn't have the proper privileges
to access the management API to collect metrics. Check the Permission
section in RabbitMQ documentation at https://www.rabbitmq.com/management.html
for futher precision regarding the permission model.

Closes-Bug: 1750582
Change-Id: Iebf279ca591e646656f8411934fd58dc43d5f002
(cherry picked from commit 45cebe81c267951c2ebff07ec371751dc26c2d22)
(cherry picked from commit cc81c1d40feb399e34b96284e7da80354717ada6)

commit_message:
Added monitoring tag to monitoring user creation task.

Without that tag, the monitoring user doesn't have the proper privileges
to access the management API to collect metrics. Check the Permission
section in RabbitMQ documentation at https://www.rabbitmq.com/management.html
for futher precision regarding the permission model.

Closes-Bug: 1750582
Change-Id: Iebf279ca591e646656f8411934fd58dc43d5f002
(cherry picked from commit 45cebe81c267951c2ebff07ec371751dc26c2d22)
(cherry picked from commit cc81c1d40feb399e34b96284e7da80354717ada6)

This is not switching back and forth. This was never done for Ocata, which is why newton->ocata is failing. revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 08:53:57.000000000', 'message': 'Move Upgrade branch change above initial library source

Upgrades fail on master due to changes to the library functions,
specifically "get_pip" which now requires a variable passed to it. Since
the library was sourced before it gets called in the Ocata branch this
caused failures when the function was called.

To fix this we should source the library after we change branches, and
not before. Additionally, we should source the scripts-library.sh from
master once we change back to the master branch.

Change-Id: If3fedfcf2dd5b13c918812fcb9aca7efea7d0f26
(cherry picked from commit ece5067966ca769a892e20b938fdb9d2589b49a4)
'}]
commit_message:
Move Upgrade branch change above initial library source

Upgrades fail on master due to changes to the library functions,
specifically "get_pip" which now requires a variable passed to it. Since
the library was sourced before it gets called in the Ocata branch this
caused failures when the function was called.

To fix this we should source the library after we change branches, and
not before. Additionally, we should source the scripts-library.sh from
master once we change back to the master branch.

Change-Id: If3fedfcf2dd5b13c918812fcb9aca7efea7d0f26
(cherry picked from commit ece5067966ca769a892e20b938fdb9d2589b49a4)

commit_message:
Downloads amphora images from artifact storage

This will download a test amphora image per default form the
Open Stack artifact storage to speed up tests. Operators can
configure their won artifact storage to simplify deploys.

(cherry picked from commit 95eee6bc11e97105cb0356d7475bee699d404bda0)

commit_message:
Update initramfs when links change

In order to make the default link take effect initramfs needs to be
updated. This change also updates the default link to use the
recommended defaults from the systemd-networkd documentation.

Default link config:
- https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.link.html#Examples

See this thread for bug info:
- https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=793374

Change-Id: I5430da4acad1e36b7593ad6791afbebf9e730bba
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Disable the pip version check
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-20 12:00:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-20 12:03:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-20 13:08:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-20 13:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-20 13:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from 563093 to bp/python-build-install-simplification'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-20 13:32:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-21 08:43:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-04-22 13:18:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 12:00:54.000000000', 'message': 'Disable the pip version check

In our logs it is frequent that the warning to upgrade the
pip version is present, but this warning is unnecessary as
we are always using a well tested version of pip.

To reduce noise, we set disable the version check. This has
the added benefit of not adding more internet access to every
pip task than is necessary.

Change-Id: Ie0427d3435270836302441b92eaff7e7980d7047
'}, {'created': '2018-04-20 12:03:21.000000000', 'message': "Disable the pip version check

In our logs it is frequent that the warning to upgrade the
pip version is present, but this warning is unnecessary as
we are always using a well tested version of pip.

To reduce noise, we set disable the version check. This has
the added benefit of not adding more internet access to every
pip task than is necessary.

In the template we ensure that the var is interpreted as a
boolean (in case of user error), then force it to lower case
as that's what pip prefers in pip.conf.

Change-Id: Ie0427d3435270836302441b92eaff7e7980d7047
"}, {'created': '2018-04-20 13:08:56.000000000', 'message': "Disable the pip version check

In our logs it is frequent that the warning to upgrade the
pip version is present, but this warning is unnecessary as
we are always using a well tested version of pip.

To reduce noise, we set disable the version check. This has
the added benefit of not adding more internet access to every
pip task than is necessary.

In the template we ensure that the var is interpreted as a
boolean (in case of user error), then force it to lower case
as that's what pip prefers in pip.conf.

We also now remove the check for the self check file, as it
will no longer be present with this option implemented.

Change-Id: Ie0427d3435270836302441b92eaff7e7980d7047

commit_message:
Disable the pip version check

In our logs it is frequent that the warning to upgrade the
pip version is present, but this warning is unnecessary as
we are always using a well tested version of pip.

To reduce noise, we set disable the version check. This has
the added benefit of not adding more internet access to every
pip task than is necessary.

In the template we ensure that the var is interpreted as a
boolean (in case of user error), then force it to lower case
as that's what pip prefers in pip.conf.

We also now remove the test for the self check file, as it
will no longer be present with this option implemented.

Change-Id: Ie0427d3435270836302441b92eaff7e7980d7047

python bindings for Ceph. Moreover, openSUSE is using python2 by default

commit_message:
SUSE: Add missing Ceph packages and drop the python3 ones

python-rbd and python-rgw are also required to complete the list of all
python bindings for Ceph. Moreover, openSUSE is using python2 by default
so we don't need to pull any python3-* packages (and all the python3
dependencies) for no reason.

Change-Id: Idda06486fa6ba30378c4e632ff50b5baa577caf9
(cherry picked from commit e4e768ca2372e0d5838fc0e57ef6a120aab05d06)

[{'created': '2018-04-20 07:50:41.000000000', 'message': "Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available

Change-Id: I982e042c472693ba73702b9be15438c1a0c045c2

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I982e042c472693ba73702b9be15438c1a0c045c2
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 1c10d38b6d3d725b68f61f3c695b7e2051c541e8)

subject: Replace virtualenv-tools by a script
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-20 07:49:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-21 08:37:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-04-22 13:11:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 07:49:40.000000000', 'message': "Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: If934acbcfe81578366d1ecc0c5fec7c6de5b2040
Partial-Bug: #1741634
(cherry picked from commit 01597f254c04f30748f9eeee70aace4bd123eec7)
"}]
commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: If934acbcfe81578366d1ecc0c5fec7c6de5b2040
Partial-Bug: #1741634
(cherry picked from commit 01597f254c04f30748f9eeee70aace4bd123eec7)

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

This also removes the duplicate openstack_hosts role from
the ansible-role-requirements.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556281
Change-Id: I4f4c9541d80d3c1cdaae7e9ab7f839aac92663b0

[{'account_id': 27961, 'date': '2018-03-23 16:43:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-03-23 16:44:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-03-23 19:06:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-23 16:43:43.000000000', 'message': "Add `hide_hypervisor_id` flavor extra_spec

This blueprint intends to add the capability of hiding the kvm signature from guests: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-kvm-hidden-feature
However, it is implemented only through an image property.

A major reason for this feature is to allow passed-through Nvidia GPUs to work correctly. GPU pci-passthrough is specified on the flavor's extra_specs, without requiring an image with special properties. Therefore, hiding the KVM signature should also be specifiable through the flavor's extra_specs, in order to not require a special image for this use case.

Change-Id: I41c5913b4148629b448ea5fb43b7597dc067dc22
Partial-Bug: 1757424

from guests:

commit_message:
Add `hide_hypervisor_id` flavor extra_spec

Blueprint add-kvm-hidden-feature added the capability of hiding the kvm
signature from guests. However, it was implemented only through an image
property.

A major reason for this feature is to allow passed-through Nvidia GPUs
to work correctly. GPU pci-passthrough is specified on the flavor's
extra_specs, without requiring an image with special properties.
Therefore, hiding the KVM signature should also be specifiable through
the flavor's extra_specs, in order to not require a special image for
this use case.

If the new flavor extra_spec is present and set to 'true', the libvirt
driver will produce an additional element to hide kvm's signature on
the vm, in the same way as with the image property
`img_hide_hypervisor_id`.

Implements: blueprint hide-hypervisor-id-flavor-extra-spec
Closes-Bug: 1757424
Change-Id: I41c5913b4148629b448ea5fb43b7597dc067dc22

Currently source based balancing is used for both opendaylight and
opendaylgiht_ws which results in the load being spread across only 2
bacnekds instead of 3 (as confirmed by scale tests). This commit changes
the haproxy configuration for opendaylight and opendaylight_ws to use

'}]
commit_message:
Changing opendaylight loadbalancing alogirthm

Currently source based balancing is used for both opendaylight and
opendaylgiht_ws which results in the load being spread across only 2
bacnekds instead of 3 (as confirmed by scale tests). This commit changes
the haproxy configuration for opendaylight and opendaylight_ws to use
roundrobin which is the default.

Change-Id: Idb4fe3803f69ab7440aaa2997cc4de46c9ac5458
Closes-Bug: 1762518

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

Note that manila-ui does not support python3 yet so lower-constraints
env uses python2 unlike other projects.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ia808cae058ab5d7bd5435ad57543eb8b9bcc96db
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Signed-off-by: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Install dirmngr

The package dirmngr isn't installed in Debian by default, but it is needed
in order for gnupg to work. As a consequence, in Debian, managing the repository
key for Ceph didn't work.

This patch therefore adds dirmngr in the list of packages to install before
anything else.

Change-Id: I71ddb386a6a47639ae707eafeb848391e3b05cf4

commit_message:
Update keystone functional tests

This change removes v2.0 from the list of versions to test when
running keystone's own functional tests. This also adds in project_name
and project_domain_id when specifying parameters to build an
authentication request.

Change-Id: I960935d8e8daf51a39e2ea7d9d53af1d9eefdbb2

subject: Add networking-l2gw OSC commands
messages:
[{'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2018-03-31 19:58:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-04-02 11:01:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Not sure if I did something wrong while testing the patch in my environment, or something is not right. I need to take some more time to test it. I'm getting this anyway: 

[centos@devstack ~]$ openstack l2gw list           
Exception raised: No module named networking_l2gw.l2gw 

Anyway, thanks for your contribution Lajos!"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-02 13:50:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

As the policy of this repo, a corresponding project needs to be under the neutron stadium before merging OSC support. Is there any plan that networking-l2gw will be a part of official projects under the neutron project? I would like to know the current plan first.

If there is no plan to be under the neutron project governance, the recommended way is to implement OSC plugin in the networking-l2gw repo.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2018-04-03 09:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ricardo: I checked and after pip installing python-neutronclient with the patch for me the openstack l2gw list.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2018-04-03 09:34:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Akihiro: could you help to find out if this code should be in networking-l2gw repo, or in python-neutronclient repo.
Should it be some formal decision from neutron community?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-04 05:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Lajos Katona wrote:

> Akihiro: could you help to find out if this code should be in
> networking-l2gw repo, or in python-neutronclient repo. Should it be
> some formal decision from neutron community?

The current formal consensus are:
- neutronclient repo is that we accept on CLI supports for official networking API defined in neutron-lib API definitions and references.
- The official networking API is APIs defined by projects under the neutron project governance [1]
- Officla projects are evaluated based on the stadium health checksheet [2][3][4]

The stadium health was evaluated in Ocata and after that we evaluated it for project inclusion (neutron-vpnaas) so far. We can discuss it in the team meeting if networking-l2gw team would like to discuss it.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/projects/neutron.html
[2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/stadium/index.html
[3] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/stadium/ocata/index.html
[4] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/stadium/ocata/networking-l2gw.html'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-04-04 10:27:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Lajos Katona wrote:
 > 
 > > Akihiro: could you help to find out if this code should be in
 > > networking-l2gw repo, or in python-neutronclient repo. Should it
 > be
 > > some formal decision from neutron community?
 > 
 > The current formal consensus are:
 > - neutronclient repo is that we accept on CLI supports for official
 > networking API defined in neutron-lib API definitions and
 > references.
 > - The official networking API is APIs defined by projects under the
 > neutron project governance [1]
 > - Officla projects are evaluated based on the stadium health
 > checksheet [2][3][4]
 > 
 > The stadium health was evaluated in Ocata and after that we
 > evaluated it for project inclusion (neutron-vpnaas) so far. We can
 > discuss it in the team meeting if networking-l2gw team would like
 > to discuss it.
 > 
 > [1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/projects/neutron.html
 > [2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/stadium/index.html
 > [3] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/stadium/ocata/index.html
 > [4] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/stadium/ocata/networking-l2gw.html

Hello guys,

Networking-l2gw community doesn't have the capacity to keep up in the Neutron Stadium. We are slowly contributing to get closer by increasing our CI coverage/health, porting client to OSC, etc. But I really don't think we are ready to do this for now. Adding Miguel Lavalle to know his opinion."}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-04-12 20:40:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

As Ricardo indicated, this networking-l2gw is not part of the Neutron stadium'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-04-12 20:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2018-04-13 06:56:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Miguel.
Ricardo: shall I move this to netorking-l2gw repo?'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-04-16 08:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Thanks Miguel.
 > Ricardo: shall I move this to netorking-l2gw repo?

Yes please. Thanks Lajos'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2018-04-22 06:10:49.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

As networking-l2gw is not a neutron stadium the osc plugin can't be in python-neutronclient.
A corresponding change in networking-l2gw repo: I3ad1c6fdde9c3cfc8732680f130fbd6420d98c53"}]

commit_message:
Always deploy NTP

No matter how many NTP servers we have in undercloud.conf, we need NTP
service running correctly, so the undercloud is always on time.
The default configuration already provide sane defaults
(X.centos.pool.ntp.org) so let's configure the service all the time.

Change-Id: I946f055b119ea878c893bd333ebb5f2c9d68ea6d

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Fixing the eventlet entry also requires making the lower-constraints
list match the requirements range.

Change-Id: I69a895bfa4f4caa6dff3109375503f7a7bcbd626
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2018-04-04 10:03:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix healthcheck script for neutron-api service

Current script expects neutron-api to run with mod_wsgi
Update to point to bind_host:bind_port and proper defaults

Change-Id: I8b79bbb3d9831e58e5bcbb9144d2073c6ec0391c
Closes-Bug: #1761122
'}]
commit_message:
Fix healthcheck script for neutron-api service

Current script expects neutron-api to run with mod_wsgi
Update to point to bind_host:bind_port and proper defaults

Change-Id: I8b79bbb3d9831e58e5bcbb9144d2073c6ec0391c
Closes-Bug: #1761122

commit_message:
Ensure that policy file exist

Since Ocata staging on Ubuntu Cloud archive, policy.json file
has been dropped because default policies are registred in code.
To avoid puppet errors on creating new policy rules, ensure that the
file exist.

Workaround for Ocata release, where DB sync is raising an error,
when policy.json file is empty.

Change-Id: Ida67676cb8941c021363967458d2b23db2acf6bd
(cherry picked from commit d5b60e5d2fba372269c00f081ea3ea624993e895)

yeah, that's what i was guessing. it really seems like you're trying to 'revert' the patch that fixes bug1649333"}, {'account_id': 24680, 'date': '2018-01-31 21:37:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> yeah, that's what i was guessing. it really seems like you're
 > trying to 'revert' the patch that fixes bug1649333

Not really revert, but improve :D
I can try to "redesign" PS, but if all my suggestions are bad, we should think to remove edit functionality.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2018-01-31 22:35:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

i'm adding Zane. i'll be honest, this seems to just re-enable the previous scenario which was deemed a security risk."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-01 21:06:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

IIUC the problem is that if a client does a GET then the actions will be reported verbatim, including trust IDs. If the client then does a PUT with that data (even without modifying it) then it will fail because it contains trust IDs.

So the idea is that if the trust ID in the URL is the same one that Aodh itself created for this tenant and this alarm, then it's safe. This is a sound concept in principle.

I do wonder if it might be less risky to simply strip the trust IDs from the actions when doing a GET instead. It's already a little odd that the URL you get back is not the one you sent in.

I also think that the logic in patch set 1/2 was better, and I'm not clear on why you think we need to skip the rest of the loop body."}, {'account_id': 24680, 'date': '2018-02-02 10:34:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24680, 'date': '2018-02-02 10:34:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 24680, 'date': '2018-02-02 10:34:31.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by Daniel Pawlik <pawlik.dan@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 20676, 'date': '2018-02-04 22:06:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 20676, 'date': '2018-02-04 22:17:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-02-05 12:00:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

test ?'}, {'account_id': 20676, 'date': '2018-02-05 14:00:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

Tests: WIP'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-06 14:46:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

You need to use the new 'password' instead of the existing 'password'. Other than that, this looks OK.

That said, did you consider my suggestion to strip the trust data on when reading it instead of when writing it back?"}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2018-02-09 20:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck new-pifpaf'}, {'account_id': 20676, 'date': '2018-03-03 19:11:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-26 17:07:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I proposed I230c0d80a9440c7d002b9a623048ef715a9df743 as an alternative solution, in which we scrub the trust IDs out of the action URLs when doing a GET instead of allowing correct trust IDs to be fed back in on a PUT. I documented in the commit message why I think that way is better, although ultimately I'm relaxed about which approach gets merged (this patch still needs some fixups before it could be merged though)."}, {'account_id': 20676, 'date': '2018-04-21 21:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Patch from is better: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555500/'}]

commit_message:
Fix error on updating Aodh alarm

After fixing bug with Keystone trust [1], created alarm
can not be updated, becuase url contains trust_id in the
url.
On update, Aodh should just check if trusted_id was provided
for this alarm.

Closes-Bug: #1737186

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/aodh/+bug/1649333

Change-Id: I76267ab9cefbc22f2264d4e98374dd3ab4763635

commit_message:
Change the format of memory field

In before, the container's memory field is displayed as '512M'.
The original intent is to support other memory unit, such as 'K',
'G', etc. However, this will make the code more complicated since
it needs to handle many possible inputs. Let's use 'M' as the only
memory unit, then remove the tailing 'M' since the information
is redundant.

Depends-On: Ief00d4899a9628967aa6ea875aa4195cc4f2bfc4
Closes-Bug: #1764923
Change-Id: I5f586ccc73f53a5f6e6e4d341251a5288a8687f2

commit_message:
Add missing undercloud upgrade tasks

Nova API and Mistral API need to be stopped because they'll be
containerized during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I9f8af1cd2e775a92a0b1acf2ae9eec12f6c90974

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I3aa4ed26fefed016c2eda3bed853fbb0a47a0692
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Cheers,
gibi'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-03-22 09:56:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

Thanks alot for the replies, spent alot of time digging into the unmatch problem today, and it is because we used noauth when doing tests

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/tests/unit/conf_fixture.py#L53

So, the req.environ['openstack.request_id'] is not translated to context.request_id and nova generated a new one, and thus they don't match."}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-03-22 11:41:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-03-26 14:55:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> I chose to mock out the generate_request_id() method, because there
 > are too many cases to be handled in the tests...

Thanks for fixing the NoAuth request_id issue. I think now that is fixed you can simply add a request_id field to the api client in the functional test and if that is set then the content will be included in the request and by your fix that will end up in the context. 
This does not need mocking or changing every test case or test class. It can be done once in the base notification test class.

Cheers,
gibi


diff --git a/nova/tests/functional/api/client.py b/nova/tests/functional/api/client.py
index 11cbf2d2e4..b6ec829669 100644
--- a/nova/tests/functional/api/client.py
+++ b/nova/tests/functional/api/client.py
@@ -126,6 +126,7 @@ class TestOpenStackClient(object):
         else:
             self.project_id = project_id
         self.microversion = None
+        self.request_id = None
 
     def request(self, url, method='GET', body=None, headers=None):
         _headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json'}
@@ -184,6 +185,9 @@ class TestOpenStackClient(object):
             headers['X-OpenStack-Nova-API-Version'] = self.microversion
             headers['OpenStack-API-Version'] = 'compute %s' % self.microversion
 
+        if self.request_id:
+            headers['x-openstack-request-id'] = self.request_id
+
         response = self.request(full_uri, **kwargs)
 
         http_status = response.status_code

+        self.admin_api.request_id = 'req-d964decf-7c15-4232-985c-0f574c10d963'

I think the deduplicate patches should merge pretty quickly, there are just a couple that need some changes now. Then this patch will be much smaller once the request_id is in the common payload at the end.'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-04-16 01:13:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Hi guys, I may need some suggestions here. The tests of the latest patchset will fail and it is due to:

We are using NoAuthMiddleware in the tests and thus the context will not have context.auth_token:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/619f7c23b352653a8a77ab7209abbd2500d82a09/nova/api/openstack/auth.py#L29

so the judgement about periodic tasks on context.auth_token could not work. And after some thinking, I think maybe we should not even use context.auth_token for this kind of judgement as someone may actually using NoAuthMiddleware...

So what should be the best solution for this?'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-04-19 12:02:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-04-19 12:06:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review-1

'}, {'created': '2018-03-22 14:13:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add request_id to isntance action notifications

As it was agreed on the Rocky PTG [1] it is useful to have the
request_id of in the payload of every instance action versioned
notification. For example it could help the deployer connect
the state change described in the notification with the user
action, the request, on the REST API.

So this patch proposes to extend the InstanceActionPayload
versioned object with a new request_id field and populate
the request_id from the context object used for emitting
the instance action notifications.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-ptg-rocky L391

Implements: bp add-request-id-to-instance-action-notifications

Change-Id: I7243b60938d6e9c7c2bc2aacdba5c667cca8ec9b

commit_message:
Add request_id to instance action notifications

As it was agreed on the Rocky PTG [1] it is useful to have the
request_id of in the payload of every instance action versioned
notification. For example it could help the deployer connect
the state change described in the notification with the user
action, the request, on the REST API.

So this patch proposes to extend the InstanceActionPayload
versioned object with a new request_id field and populate
the request_id from the context object used for emitting
the instance action notifications.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-ptg-rocky L391

Implements: bp add-request-id-to-instance-action-notifications

Change-Id: I7243b60938d6e9c7c2bc2aacdba5c667cca8ec9b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 13:50:43.000000000', 'message': "Upgrade: make bundles use new container image name after upgrade

The major_upgrade tasks for HA services only allows to change the container
image tag used by bundles. It doesn't work when the image name changes.

Fix this unwanted behaviour by updating the bundle's attribute in pacemaker
to use container image <NEW>:pcmklatest instead of <CURRENT>:pcmklatest
We are constrained by the steps at when we can modify the bundle:
  . Image update must stay at step 3 when pacemaker is stopped.
  . image name used by the bundle must be available in docker when the
    bundle is updated

So we re-use the double tagging idiom to perform the image update:
  . At step 0, we tag the image pointed to by <CURRENT>:pcmklatest
    with an additional temporary tag <NEW>:pcmklatest.
    => this ensures that at step1, the new tag is available on all
       controller nodes.
  . At step 1, we update the resource bundle to use the new image
    name <NEW>:pcmklatest.
    => at the end of step1, the bundle will be configured with the
       new name, and be able to start even if the real container
       image hasn't be pulled yet.
  . At step 3, the existing code will download the real image
    <NEW>:<NEWTAG> and make tag <NEW>:pcmklatest point to it.

Since the bundle is always modified, we now stop and restart the
bundle resources unconditionally.

Also, move the mariadb upgrade task to step 3, when pacemaker is
guaranteed to be stopped, because the task assumes that no mysql
is running while it runs.

Change-Id: Ic87a66753b104b9f15db70fdccbd66d88cef94df
Closes-Bug: #1763001
(cherry picked from commit 081590031a1f51d8483491913b1bcaa056512c31)
"}, {'created': '2018-04-17 08:19:26.000000000', 'message': "Upgrade: make bundles use new container image name after upgrade

image tag used by bundles. It doesn't work when the image name changes.

to use container image <NEW>:pcmklatest instead of <CURRENT>:pcmklatest
We are constrained by the steps at when we can modify the bundle:
  . Image update must stay at step 3 when pacemaker is stopped.
  . image name used by the bundle must be available in docker when the
    bundle is updated

So we re-use the double tagging idiom to perform the image update:
  . At step 0, we tag the image pointed to by <CURRENT>:pcmklatest
    with an additional temporary tag <NEW>:pcmklatest.
    => this ensures that at step1, the new tag is available on all
       controller nodes.
  . At step 1, we update the resource bundle to use the new image
    name <NEW>:pcmklatest.
    => at the end of step1, the bundle will be configured with the
       new name, and be able to start even if the real container
       image hasn't be pulled yet.
  . At step 3, the existing code will download the real image
    <NEW>:<NEWTAG> and make tag <NEW>:pcmklatest point to it.

Since the bundle is always modified, we now stop and restart the
bundle resources unconditionally.

Also, move the mariadb upgrade task to step 3, when pacemaker is
guaranteed to be stopped, because the task assumes that no mysql
is running while it runs. Fix the mysql permission after rpm
upgrade on the host.

Change-Id: Ic87a66753b104b9f15db70fdccbd66d88cef94df
Closes-Bug: #1763001
(cherry picked from commit e8a1fc25d77b89ad82e854e1f19a247d3d990f2b)

commit_message:
Upgrade: make bundles use new container image name after upgrade

The major_upgrade tasks for HA services only allows to change the container
image tag used by bundles. It doesn't work when the image name changes.

Fix this unwanted behaviour by updating the bundle's attribute in pacemaker
to use container image <NEW>:pcmklatest instead of <CURRENT>:pcmklatest
We are constrained by the steps at when we can modify the bundle:
  . Image update must stay at step 3 when pacemaker is stopped.
  . image name used by the bundle must be available in docker when the
    bundle is updated

So we re-use the double tagging idiom to perform the image update:
  . At step 0, we tag the image pointed to by <CURRENT>:pcmklatest
    with an additional temporary tag <NEW>:pcmklatest.
    => this ensures that at step1, the new tag is available on all
       controller nodes.
  . At step 1, we update the resource bundle to use the new image
    name <NEW>:pcmklatest.
    => at the end of step1, the bundle will be configured with the
       new name, and be able to start even if the real container
       image hasn't be pulled yet.
  . At step 3, the existing code will download the real image
    <NEW>:<NEWTAG> and make tag <NEW>:pcmklatest point to it.

Since the bundle is always modified, we now stop and restart the
bundle resources unconditionally.

Also, move the mariadb upgrade task to step 3, when pacemaker is
guaranteed to be stopped, because the task assumes that no mysql
is running while it runs. Fix the mysql permission after rpm
upgrade on the host.

Change-Id: Ic87a66753b104b9f15db70fdccbd66d88cef94df
Closes-Bug: #1763001
(cherry picked from commit e8a1fc25d77b89ad82e854e1f19a247d3d990f2b)

commit_message:
Explicitly use iscsi for standalone BaremetalIpmiRescuePartitioned

This test uses partition images and netboot, which the ansible deploy
interface does not support. Since we only update the interfaces we
specify when choosing a node, if we choose a node that's already using
the ansible interface, we'll fail here. Explicitly set the iscsi
interface to avoid this situation.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/563119
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/563120
Change-Id: I852fbe8d2d34a5d301d3591af6cd67c4dcda3b83

commit_message:
FFU: Use yum shell instead of ansible yum module

Ansible yum module installs all packages available in the repo
 if you use asterix. We instead will use yum -y update name*.

Change-Id: I8e71367ae91faa06313711c6a954c61af705fd8f
Resolves: rhbz#1549845
(cherry picked from commit c2536e22f1a0d75ae62a974a2db47343dd671678)

commit_message:
Initialize db for Barbican Keystone listener

Barbican keystone listener needs to have its db initialized.
Also adding barbican-keystone-listener to run in devstack.
Functional tests will be added in a subsequent commit.

Depends-On: I148b1c8e265b327d60d76f88c036b032af014930
Cherry-picked-From: 7061d65c
Change-Id: Ie80a2e67a4ed4e62326b716b4925b7d4aa39eb77
Closed-Bug: 1750333

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 09:10:19.000000000', 'message': 'Configure qemu group setting as hugetlbfs for ovs-dpdk

Till now, the ovs service file and ovs-ctl command files
are patched to allow ovs to run with qemu group. In order
to remove this workarounds, a new group hugetlbfs is created
which will be shared between ovs and qemu. This patch contains
the changes required for applying these changes.

Vhostuser Socket Directory is changed from
"/var/run/openvswitch" to "/var/lib/vhost_sockets" to avoid
modifying the directory access by packaged scripts.

Depends-On: I5fc2f852c66c2b825af96aba2657d0f9085dc8c3
Patch-url: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547961/

Change-Id: Id727a514610816c8223aa0dcd49a70caec29a21d

commit_message:
Configure qemu group setting as hugetlbfs for ovs-dpdk

Till now, the ovs service file and ovs-ctl command files
are patched to allow ovs to run with qemu group. In order
to remove this workarounds, a new group hugetlbfs is created
which will be shared between ovs and qemu. This patch contains
the changes required for applying these changes.

Patch-url: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547961/

Change-Id: Id727a514610816c8223aa0dcd49a70caec29a21d
(cherry picked from commit 825bd7d9e13ccbdf552e3bb01718d043d83487c6)

commit_message:
Add FFU converge step

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559061/ introduced a ffwd-upgrade-
converge.yaml environment file to be used at the end of the ffu
process, before running the ceph upgrade. This change adjusts the
workflow to include the converge stage.

In addition it adjusts the scenario environment file in the overcloud
deploy script so any scripts built of it make use of the new one.

Change-Id: I1b2c9e0d804b511c6c6e2cce34ed83fca8065bae
(cherry picked from commit d8370a52be7803f78df6ded4c3f8481227dc9995)

messages:
[{'account_id': 16150, 'date': '2018-04-17 10:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-17 10:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/561862/1/ : FAILURE in 10m 25s'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-04-17 11:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-16721 : FAILURE in 1h 09m 07s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-17 14:00:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is an eminently sane change.  Thank you for putting it together.

I don't think the test case exercises the change, really.  Though it's more than what was there before, so that's all goodness.  But perhaps we should have a setup that uses more than one provider with allocations and ensures we get the right answer when each/both are full."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-04-17 14:29:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Yeah, seems like a good idea, some comments within. I agree with Eric's suggestion that the testing could be more complete. Thanks for following through with this."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-04-17 14:32:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> This is an eminently sane change.  Thank you for putting it
 > together.

This isn't actually a change that should be needed. The JOIN condition already has the resource provider ID in it, and therefore the JOIN condition should "push down" the filter of resource provider IDs into the derived table (the subquery in the FROM clause) already.

 > I don't think the test case exercises the change, really.  Though
 > it's more than what was there before, so that's all goodness.

Actually, no, we already have plenty of functional tests for this here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/db/test_resource_provider.py#L709-L843

The issue is that these are not unit tests and the added test here is placed in the unit tests.

 >  But
 > perhaps we should have a setup that uses more than one provider
 > with allocations and ensures we get the right answer when each/both
 > are full.

That is a fine suggestion. That said, however, before I'm OK with this patch, I'd like to see the output of EXPLAIN SELECT before and after the change to show that this patch actually is changing the query execution plan.

Lei, you can retrieve the query execution plan by executing an EXPLAIN SELECT for the SQL generated by the _check_capacity_exceeded() function.

Thank you!

-jay'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-17 16:19:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> This isn't actually a change that should be needed. The JOIN condition already has the resource provider ID in it, and therefore the JOIN condition should "push down" the filter of resource provider IDs into the derived table (the subquery in the FROM clause) already.

EXPLAIN will tell, but from my rude understanding the inner SELECT is going to pull the allocation records for all providers before the LEFT JOIN's WHERE clause filters them back out.

Lei, did you say you were able to demonstrate a performance improvement with this change?'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-04-17 16:53:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > This isn't actually a change that should be needed. The JOIN
 > condition already has the resource provider ID in it, and therefore
 > the JOIN condition should "push down" the filter of resource
 > provider IDs into the derived table (the subquery in the FROM
 > clause) already.
 > 
 > EXPLAIN will tell, but from my rude understanding the inner SELECT
 > is going to pull the allocation records for all providers before
 > the LEFT JOIN's WHERE clause filters them back out.

No, that isn't true. The optimizer has a choice to either materialize the view of the derived table into a temporary table (which means essentially perform the subquery before evaluating the outer joined-to table) or it can do what is called merging of the derived table into the outer selections.

If the tables are properly indexed, the merging of the derived table should happen, which is what I'm referring to here.

For more information, see here:

https://www.ppgia.pucpr.br/pt/arquivos/techdocs/mysql/optimization.html#derived-table-optimization

specifically.. this:

"The optimizer handles derived tables and view references the same way: It avoids unnecessary materialization whenever possible, which enables pushing down conditions from the outer query to derived tables and produces more efficient execution plans."'}, {'account_id': 16150, 'date': '2018-04-18 09:22:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Hi Jay, I put the output of two versions EXPLAIN SELECT here, http://paste.openstack.org/show/719444/, the first one is our current code, second is the patch proposed.

I've created 100 non shared resource providers with 20 vms on each, so the records of allocation table is about 100 * 20 * 3(cpu, memory, disk) = 6000. 

The optimizer doesn't merge the subquery as you can see a derived table allocations from both result. With a resource_provider_id check the derived table examines less rows than current code(60 versus 6083 in the EXPLAIN stats.

I noticed something from the article you provide:

It is possible to disable merging by using in the subquery any constructs that prevent merging, although these are not as explicit in their effect on materialization. Constructs that prevent merging are the same for derived tables and view references:

Aggregate functions (SUM(), MIN(), MAX(), COUNT(), and so forth)

DISTINCT

GROUP BY....

Maybe it's the reason why subquery merging doesn't happen here, and current code will materialize the result of allocation subquery."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-04-18 09:44:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Hi Jay, I put the output of two versions EXPLAIN SELECT here,
 > http://paste.openstack.org/show/719444/, the first one is our
 > current code, second is the patch proposed.
 > 
 > I've created 100 non shared resource providers with 20 vms on each,
 > so the records of allocation table is about 100 * 20 * 3(cpu,
 > memory, disk) = 6000.
 
Thanks for the link to the EXPLAIN result. Have you found other queries that are not behaving as well as desired?"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-04-18 14:56:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

OK, yes, for some reason the condition isn't pushed down into the derived table. I have a suspicion that *maybe* this isn't happening because we have a single WHERE condition in the derived table for WHERE resource_class IN (...). If that is removed, I'm wondering if the query execution plan would in fact be superior...

Lei, feel like testing out that theory? :)

-jay"}, {'account_id': 16150, 'date': '2018-04-19 12:59:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Chris, not yet, if I meet other bottleneck I'll come with patches.

@Jay, do you mean to remove this 'WHERE resource_class_id IN ($RESOURCE_CLASSES)' in allocations subquery? I tested it but result is not positive, no push down happens, http://paste.openstack.org/show/719558/."}, {'account_id': 16150, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:12:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-04-19 14:12:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-17010 : FAILURE in 59m 26s'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-04-19 14:20:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Lei, I'm curious what version of MySQL you are using. Unless I'm mistaken, this sort of optimization *should* be done by the MySQL query optimizer automatically. Clearly it isn't here.

I may submit a bug report to Oracle about it...

In any case, it's certainly not like this patch hurts anything and you've demonstrated that the query plan produced by the patch is indeed superior to the original one.

Thanks!

-jay"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-19 14:44:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-19 16:51:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/561862/2/ : SUCCESS in 3h 05m 23s'}]

commit_message:
Improve check capacity sql

During a benchmark on allocation creation, I found checking allocations
capacity occupied a great amount of time when allocation table is fairly
big. Add a check on resource provider id to reduce allocation records to
be joined with resource providers and inventories.

Change-Id: Ic36809fa7161c2aa07a42669b44046993e5db058

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs stable job

With the introduction of pip 10 the sphinx-docs stable jobs fail, due
to pip does not allow to call "pip install" without any package name
any more [1]

"ERROR: You must give at least one requirement to install"

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas/stable/queens/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/75e7730/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-21_06_20_25_808996

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I67d2ab519d1baf463e4ad253b8a85b5194ad31f6
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add python3 functional voting and non-voting jobs

In I4052547b5dc1e70a7fb079dcd13ec2a32d5efefe we're removing the plugins
job from the plugins repo and adding it to tests, this will allow us to
use these jobs for the ansible-config_template repo as well as the
openstack-ansible-plugins repo.

Change-Id: Id6c1bfb4b93e7d37c76c891dc537567d7df0d5c5
(cherry picked from commit 379e4776852f956f24996c67f87338af5fcd5213)

commit_message:
Support filter search for share type API

Add support for extra_specs filter search in type list API.

Change-Id: I43fbef2a32489f2064586a3674eb34329f3503c4
Implements: blueprint support-filter-search-for-share-type

commit_message:
Remove todo as mistral tag filtering is fixed

Fixed tag filtering in mistral so it is safe to remove the workaround

commit_message:
Revert "Fixes ceph-external docker service name"

This reverts commit b02740533db5bbb05331f127dc22866cc870f15b. The
CephExternal service is managed like CephClient by ceph-ansible,
except for the additional parameter we need to pass to explicitly
list the MONs.

Change-Id: Icb56b4dffb5c5d813239cb5077b1e3a4ae8f21d1
Closes-Bug: #1765788
(cherry picked from commit 26f820563589b0cccbdd8957b1ede90e6680e8c4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 22:26:22.000000000', 'message': 'Block deleting compute services which are hosting instances

This change makes "DELETE /os-services/{service_id}" fail
with a 409 response when attempting to delete a nova-compute
service which is still hosting instances.

Deleting a compute service also results in deleting the
related compute_nodes table entry for that service host.
The compute node resource provider in placement is tied
to the compute node via the UUID, and if we allow deleting
the compute service and node then the resource provider for
that node is effectively orphaned in Placement, along with
the instances which have allocations against that resource
provider.

Furthermore, restarting the compute service will create a
new service and compute_nodes record, and the compute node
would have a new UUID and resource provider. This will
affect scheduling for that host since Placement will be
reporting it as having available capacity which in reality
is not accurate.

A release note is included for the (justified) behavior
change in the API. A new microversion should not be required
for this since admins should not have to opt out of broken
behavior. Since this API did not previously expect to return
a 409 response, the "expected_errors" decorator is updated
and again, should not require a microversion per the
guidelines:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/contributor/microversions.html#when-a-microversion-is-not-needed

Change-Id: I0bd63b655ad3d3d39af8d15c781ce0a45efc8e3a
Closes-Bug: #1763183
'}, {'created': '2018-04-13 21:54:09.000000000', 'message': 'Block deleting compute services which are hosting instances

commit_message:
Block deleting compute services which are hosting instances

This change makes "DELETE /os-services/{service_id}" fail
with a 409 response when attempting to delete a nova-compute
service which is still hosting instances.

Deleting a compute service also results in deleting the
related compute_nodes table entry for that service host.
The compute node resource provider in placement is tied
to the compute node via the UUID, and if we allow deleting
the compute service and node then the resource provider for
that node is effectively orphaned in Placement, along with
the instances which have allocations against that resource
provider.

Furthermore, restarting the compute service will create a
new service and compute_nodes record, and the compute node
would have a new UUID and resource provider. This will
affect scheduling for that host since Placement will be
reporting it as having available capacity which in reality
is not accurate.

A release note is included for the (justified) behavior
change in the API. A new microversion should not be required
for this since admins should not have to opt out of broken
behavior. Since this API did not previously expect to return
a 409 response, the "expected_errors" decorator is updated
and again, should not require a microversion per the
guidelines:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/contributor/microversions.html#when-a-microversion-is-not-needed

Change-Id: I0bd63b655ad3d3d39af8d15c781ce0a45efc8e3a
Closes-Bug: #1763183

commit_message:
pip: Use 'upgrade-strategy' option to make PIP upgrades less aggressive

The default upgrade-strategy could change from one version of PIP to
another and the results may be unpredictable. We can control the PIP
behavior during upgrades using the 'upgrade-strategy' option and default
that to 'only-if-required' so PIP only upgrades what's really necessary.
This also ensure that getting the latest pip passes the idempotence test
now that we only upgrade only what's really necessary.

Depends-On: I998182eca9851d2cc745930fc73ca37bfefd0951
Link: https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/user_guide/#only-if-needed-recursive-upgrade
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
Change-Id: I2ba89e25c0010c9a5b515a3d0c9c731b30876e74

[{'created': '2018-04-20 20:02:55.000000000', 'message': "Remove tempest_git_* overrides

Presently, tempest in the integrated build is installed from PyPI, but without
constraints. This means the version installed may not be what is expected (as
we're currently seeing in the stable/pike branch).

This commit removes the tempest_git_* overrides from
playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_testing.yml, which results in
tempest getting installed from PyPI but with constraints applied.

Conflicts:
    playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_testing.yml

Change-Id: I014201129b4d6b47ec45ff6239287623123a1595
(cherry picked from commit 61e8553ae3fda9cded6acafcf0fa4861b1d3e0bd)

commit_message:
Remove tempest_git_* overrides

Presently, tempest in the integrated build is installed from PyPI, but without
constraints. This means the version installed may not be what is expected (as
we're currently seeing in the stable/pike branch).

This commit removes the tempest_git_* overrides from
playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_testing.yml, which results in
tempest getting installed from PyPI but with constraints applied.

Conflicts:
    playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_testing.yml

Change-Id: I014201129b4d6b47ec45ff6239287623123a1595
(cherry picked from commit 61e8553ae3fda9cded6acafcf0fa4861b1d3e0bd)

commit_message:
Add arg to remove config-dir for config-download

Adds an argument to config-download that removes the config-dir and
contents before downloading the config, if it exists.

Related-Bug: 1752118
Depends-On: Ie00f71b12f56262985c47810be0e80402e9e558e
Depends-On: Ibb59b044dc0c14bf48dc3d500536195230414c81
Change-Id: I68a72e11dd66d8d5100512683633caa2174f9e6b

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

- For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html
- Remove the '[build_sphinx]' as described in:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html
- This patch also changes minor mistakes in docs.

Change-Id: Iec58d57d59b98c6086910e532e16f1e417815c95

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I71c76a9173aaa7429b766225f19819715a9ccf64
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
