subject: Optimize final workflow context evaluation with a batch request
messages: [{'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-04-20 09:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-04-20 09:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-04-20 12:34:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-20 17:17:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 09:51:53.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize final workflow context evaluation with a batch request

* Evaluation of the final workflow context was an extremely
  memory expensive operation in case if we had a lot of task
  executions (which are last in their branches) to process
  and their inbound context were big (at least a few MB each).
  Mistral had to fetch the entire collection of completed
  tasks in order to do all required processing.
  This patch addresses this problem by using a batch query
  approach in conjunction with python generators that allow
  GC to destroy bathes of task executions that have already
  been processed.
  According to the tests (based on test_big_on_closures in
  test_direct_workflow.py module) memory footprint is reduced
  by 3 times (from 1.5 GB to 0.5 GB when the number of tasks is
  500 and each inbound context has 40000 entries) whereas the
  total test run time increased only by ~1%.

Change-Id: I1f016a9c0d3add35e2c5059a29a2eca00e45af42
(cherry picked from commit 62d1003ee0b78eb610dac1632d303e51f8c3932f)
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize final workflow context evaluation with a batch request

* Evaluation of the final workflow context was an extremely
  memory expensive operation in case if we had a lot of task
  executions (which are last in their branches) to process
  and their inbound context were big (at least a few MB each).
  Mistral had to fetch the entire collection of completed
  tasks in order to do all required processing.
  This patch addresses this problem by using a batch query
  approach in conjunction with python generators that allow
  GC to destroy bathes of task executions that have already
  been processed.
  According to the tests (based on test_big_on_closures in
  test_direct_workflow.py module) memory footprint is reduced
  by 3 times (from 1.5 GB to 0.5 GB when the number of tasks is
  500 and each inbound context has 40000 entries) whereas the
  total test run time increased only by ~1%.

Change-Id: I1f016a9c0d3add35e2c5059a29a2eca00e45af42
(cherry picked from commit 62d1003ee0b78eb610dac1632d303e51f8c3932f)

commit_message:
Enable BuildRequires repository in DLRN for master

Since Rocky, RDO is spliting dependencies repo in two different
repos, one for runtime requirement with the URL used in previous
releases and a new one with the packages that are only required
to build packages. This repo is not needed to deploy RDO but it's
needed to build packages with DLRN.

This patch is enabling the BuildRequires repository in DLRN
buildroot when running it in TripleO-CI when the repo is
defined.

Depends-On: I74388434e3dccfea2754569a6bc568835d49b5e2
Change-Id: I4d14d1328578edf489f6560f369142cd845591aa

commit_message:
Add ffwd-upgrade cli - overcloud ffwd-upgrade [prepare|run|converge]

Working with the sequence described in [0] with this patch and
the tripleo-common review in dependency below the operator can do:

    1 openstack overcloud ffwd-upgrade prepare ... $params
    # ^^^ added here, stack update for playbook generation.

    2 openstack overcloud ffwd-upgrade run ... $params
    # ^^^ added here. run fast_forward_upgrade_playbook.yaml
    # against the overcloud (don't expost limit_hosts)

    3 openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller
    # ^^^ exists... runs the upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml and
    # deploy_steps_playbook.yaml and
    # post_upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml. Repeat 3. with all --roles

    4 openstack overcloud ffwd-upgrade converge
    # ^^^ added here. no stack update, just unset noop from plan

Co-Authored-By: Lukas Bezdicka <social@v3.sk>
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1561178#c0
Depends-On: Ib9647b899fb9d49203c4d35c1abfe9c36e0babbe
(cherry picked from commit 78cf0c495d7ee704b9523e0ae5738602d029c264)
Change-Id: Ie7823e121a4fa57feb1c56bd4d58f3183e41b8d7

commit_message:
libvirt: log vm and task state when vif plugging times out

This enhances the warning we log when we timeout waiting
for the network-vif-plugged event from Neutron. It includes
the vm_state and task_state for context on the instance operation
since this is done for more than just the initial create, it's
also for things like rebuild.

The explicit instance uuid is also removed from the message since
sending the instance kwarg to LOG.warning logs the instance uuid
automatically. And _LW is also dropped since we no longer translate
log messages.

Conflicts:
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict is the result of _LW being required in Ocata.

Change-Id: I6daf1569cba2cfcb4e8da0b46c91d5251c9c6740
Related-Bug: #1694371
(cherry picked from commit 82ecd93a20f580a3bbec96bf570f2fcc1dc99f33)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 18:42:09.000000000', 'message': 'Detach volumes when VM creation fails

If the boot-volume creation fails, the data volume is left in state
"in-use", attached to the server which is now in "error" state.
The user can't detach the volume because of the server's error state.

They can delete the server, which then leaves the volume apparently
attached to a server that no longer exists, which is being fixed
separately: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/340614/

The only way out of this is to ask an administrator to reset the state of
the data volume (this option is not available to regular users by
default policy).

This change fixes the problem in the compute service such that
when the creation fails, compute manager detaches the created volumes
before putting the VM into error state. Then you can delete the instance
without care about attached volumes.

Conflicts:

commit_message:
Detach volumes when VM creation fails

If the boot-volume creation fails, the data volume is left in state
"in-use", attached to the server which is now in "error" state.
The user can't detach the volume because of the server's error state.

They can delete the server, which then leaves the volume apparently
attached to a server that no longer exists, which is being fixed
separately: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/340614/

The only way out of this is to ask an administrator to reset the state of
the data volume (this option is not available to regular users by
default policy).

This change fixes the problem in the compute service such that
when the creation fails, compute manager detaches the created volumes
before putting the VM into error state. Then you can delete the instance
without care about attached volumes.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict in _delete_instance is due to restructuring
the method in I9269ffa2b80e48db96c622d0dc0817738854f602 in Pike. Also
note that _LW has to be used for the warning message since those
translation markers are still required in Ocata.

Change-Id: I8b1c05317734e14ea73dc868941351bb31210bf0
Closes-bug: #1633249
(cherry picked from commit 61f6751a1807d3c3ee76d0351d17a82c6e1a915a)
(cherry picked from commit 22164d5118ea04321432432d89877aae91097e81)
(cherry picked from commit 4dbe72f976a67d442fd0e0489cadc3bc605ed012)

messages:
[{'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-04-12 10:27:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-04-12 10:27:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Testing.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-04-13 13:28:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So testing showed that it doesn't solve the issue becasue the l3 agents are in HA mode.  The ha mode prevent the failover.

It's nice to have though as it helps when the problem occurs.  It ease the application of a workaround."}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-04-16 07:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

let me know if you want to merge i can revote.'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-04-16 08:37:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-04-18 13:34:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-04-18 13:43:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-04-19 07:56:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-04-20 07:08:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 10:27:18.000000000', 'message': "[NEWTON ONLY] Fix lost of fip connectivity after upgrade.

Neutron uses the host parameter to identify its agent.  In newton we
explicitly set this to $fqdn while we were using the default before.
The default was the value of socket.gethostname.  Depending on the
system configuration that could return fqdn or hostname.

That means that when it was returning hostname, we simply change the
host id.  The previous l3 agents get lost and all fip have
disappeared.

A solution here is to make sure that the new agents take over the fip
by setting NeutronAllowL3AgentFailover to True.

This has the added benefit of adjusting Mitaka's value of that
parameter (which was false *and* saved into the registry) to the new
newton default value (which is true)

Change-Id: Ibba351ff625abfe8fd5b1f76b9a49bac120cbd8a
Closes-Bug: #1763322
"}, {'created': '2018-04-18 13:43:34.000000000', 'message': "[NEWTON ONLY] Adjust NeutronAllowL3AgentFailover to new default.

The default value of default NeutronAllowL3AgentFailover has changed
to true.  But in Mitaka that was set to false in the registry.  So
that value persists and overrides the new default.

This has no impact currently as this value is ignored neutron as the
l3 agents are in HA configuration (this parameter only work when
non-HA).

But, it's still good to have for two reasons:

 - it simplifies recovery if we hit bug #1763322, see[1]
 - it will not cause unexpected issue if we offer the possibility to
   have non-HA l3 agent.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/attachment.cgi?id=1421308

Change-Id: Ibba351ff625abfe8fd5b1f76b9a49bac120cbd8a
Related-Bug: #1763322
"}]
commit_message:
[NEWTON ONLY] Adjust NeutronAllowL3AgentFailover to new default.

The default value of default NeutronAllowL3AgentFailover has changed
to true.  But in Mitaka that was set to false in the registry.  So
that value persists and overrides the new default.

This has no impact currently as this value is ignored neutron as the
l3 agents are in HA configuration (this parameter only work when
non-HA).

But, it's still good to have for two reasons:

 - it simplifies recovery if we hit bug #1763322, see[1]
 - it will not cause unexpected issue if we offer the possibility to
   have non-HA l3 agent.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/attachment.cgi?id=1421308

Change-Id: Ibba351ff625abfe8fd5b1f76b9a49bac120cbd8a
Related-Bug: #1763322

commit_message:
Remove tempest_git_* overrides

Presently, tempest in the integrated build is installed from PyPI, but without
constraints. This means the version installed may not be what is expected (as
we're currently seeing in the stable/pike branch).

This commit removes the tempest_git_* overrides from
playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_testing.yml, which results in
tempest getting installed from PyPI but with constraints applied.

Change-Id: I014201129b4d6b47ec45ff6239287623123a1595

Enable debian-stable testing

We want to make sure our roles / playbooks work on debian-stable too.
Lets start testing them since we have nodes online.

commit_message:
Neutron: Update rootwrap for distros where python2 is the default

This PS updates rootwrap to account for distros where python2 is
the default entrypoint for python 2.7 as opposed to either python
or python2.7.

Change-Id: Ia67768985133242e0aef10bb6ce54028eabfe1cf

'}, {'created': '2018-04-04 15:56:20.000000000', 'message': "Remove Openstack and Ceph packages

As we've switched to containers, it's time to start cleaning up the
packages we install on the overcloud images by default. This change
removes all the openstack and ceph packages from the
overcloud-controller, overcloud-ceph-storage and overcloud-compute
elements.

The openstackclient and vitrage packages are left in as we do not yet
have a container completely configured for these.

Change-Id: If67d59385e62fb5f8938295aae108c5dc8bb2795
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove Openstack and Ceph packages

As we've switched to containers, it's time to start cleaning up the
packages we install on the overcloud images by default. This change
removes all the openstack and ceph packages from the
overcloud-controller, overcloud-ceph-storage and overcloud-compute
elements.

Change-Id: If67d59385e62fb5f8938295aae108c5dc8bb2795
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: If553ad33bd071792198239bc567c2e06058ebddd

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: If553ad33bd071792198239bc567c2e06058ebddd
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 23b68a02919b114c261dfa2571c01e33ee30dc3e)

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I4c99449f591dc67f0f5aa906426ea34e944ab2c7

subject: Add action to allow charm to make calls to vault
messages:
[{'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-03-29 14:10:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-03-29 14:11:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

WF-1 until functional tests are working'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-03-29 14:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-04-09 08:21:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-04-11 09:48:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So from a code perspective this all LGTM however I'm a bit unclear on why we want this - I can see that the role setup allows access from localhost to a pki backend and a secrets/ subpath.

For cert management, will the charm pass everything via relation data? i.e. the CA, cert and key will be provided to related charms via Juju rather than via direct calls to vault - if that is the case then the PKI part makes sense.

However for the general secrets part, remote charm units will require direct access to Vault - I can't see that the approle created will be able to create/update policies to support that?"}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-04-18 10:11:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-04-18 10:11:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-04-18 19:53:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-04-19 09:15:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)

I'd also like to see something in the README about using the action and what it will enable."}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-04-19 10:57:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-04-19 14:00:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-04-19 14:21:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add action to allow charm to make calls to vault

Add an action which can be run after vault has been manually
initialised and unsealed. The action creates a role that allows
localhost calls.

Change-Id: I042b49248db32e6e9a7814c74d8c25939918d0ce

commit_message:
Switch to using run_once instead of matching the first node only

Ansible allows us to run tasks once so we should use that, also
the service add is not something that has to be necessarily be
done on the first node specifically.

Change-Id: I6826fd89dfa09b8f8567a85e61c2210e8d3f76e1
(cherry picked from commit d5afc9ff8c5d0d9a0948b1b508a16976cf7853fb)

commit_message:
Switch to using run_once instead of matching the first node only

Ansible allows us to run tasks once so we should use that, also
the service add is not something that has to be necessarily be
done on the first node specifically.

Change-Id: I6826fd89dfa09b8f8567a85e61c2210e8d3f76e1
(cherry picked from commit d5afc9ff8c5d0d9a0948b1b508a16976cf7853fb)

The release-type and release jobs for this deliverable don't match. We either need to set the release-type to "horizon" here in this repo, or we need to change the release job associated with the repository in project-config. I don't know which is correct. Changing release-type will be simpler, but if you do not need horizon to build the package for the deliverable then changing the release job will be more correct.

I don't think lower bound can be changed without changing the upper-constraints https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/upper-constraints.txt#L229."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-04-17 18:52:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I've proposed https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562029/ which this chould depend on."}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-04-20 16:05:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No longer can use this version of gabbi. and also including the gabbi version update as part of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544025/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 20:46:09.000000000', 'message': "Update requirements to include latest Gabbi change

The gabbi repo was just updated so that the driver.py build_tests()
method will lists tests regardless of whether a host is configured
or reachable. This fixes the bug, but what's left is to ensure that
the new gabbi version is installed when heat-tempest-plugin is
installed.

Change-Id: Id04d56cd519e50bb5c146ce2cdf76d90118f89d4
Closes-Bug: #1749218
"}]
commit_message:
Update requirements to include latest Gabbi change

The gabbi repo was just updated so that the driver.py build_tests()
method will lists tests regardless of whether a host is configured
or reachable. This fixes the bug, but what's left is to ensure that
the new gabbi version is installed when heat-tempest-plugin is
installed.

Change-Id: Id04d56cd519e50bb5c146ce2cdf76d90118f89d4
Closes-Bug: #1749218

commit_message:
Add suppport for DNS HA

Add support for DNS HA. The config option is different from the
openstack charm config options which use a combination of the
boolean dns-ha and os-*-hostname options. However, vault only
supports one access network space.

Change-Id: I60be68d877a2949831c8a4565ccaa9a3536c8c1b

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

In order to change the requirements file, we also need to fix the lower
constraints list so that the values comply with the rules, so this patch
includes those changes as well.

Change-Id: Id503eb40432b5b3502d156e907dd342b536bf33e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Don't StartCase the role name

Start Casing role names causes names mangling for certain roles
e.g. OpenShiftMaster -> Open Shift Master (incorrect name)

Change-Id: Ia5500106bff5e8bdaae9df1e50c9ec1252c395c1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 13:06:26.000000000', 'message': "Fix gate: PEP8 and ovs-master jobs

This patch is fixing the by:

1. Update code to reflect stricter PEP8 handling

2. Adding a /bin/bash in front of the ovn-ctl commands.

The reason for 2. still unknown to me, perhaps something has changed in
Ubuntu Xenial (it doens't fail on CentOS for example) which was causing
the error below:

$ /usr/local/share/openvswitch/scripts/ovn-ctl --no-monitor start_northd
/usr/local/share/openvswitch/scripts/ovn-ctl: 1: local: -vfile:info: bad
variable name

Backport note:
The original patch in master branch included some hack for OVS. At the
moment of the cherry-pick, OVS was fixed so I removed it in
devstack/lib/networking-ovn.

Change-Id: I9dca4ba494082a0bf37833b13b05609c715a492d
(cherry picked from commit 1af6ea97bbba0b08f63ece59569ebc398a0721a7)
"}, {'created': '2018-04-16 11:29:31.000000000', 'message': "Fix gate: PEP8 and ovs-master jobs

commit_message:
Fix gate: PEP8 and ovs-master jobs

This patch is fixing the by:

1. Update code to reflect stricter PEP8 handling

2. Adding a /bin/bash in front of the ovn-ctl commands.

The reason for 2. still unknown to me, perhaps something has changed in
Ubuntu Xenial (it doens't fail on CentOS for example) which was causing
the error below:

$ /usr/local/share/openvswitch/scripts/ovn-ctl --no-monitor start_northd
/usr/local/share/openvswitch/scripts/ovn-ctl: 1: local: -vfile:info: bad
variable name

Backport note:
The original patch in master branch included some hack for OVS. At the
moment of the cherry-pick, OVS was fixed so I removed it in
devstack/lib/networking-ovn.

Change-Id: I9dca4ba494082a0bf37833b13b05609c715a492d
(cherry picked from commit 1af6ea97bbba0b08f63ece59569ebc398a0721a7)

commit_message:
Grafana: Update dashboards

This ps includes the following grafana dashboard changes:

- Renames the OpenStack dashboard title
- Removes redundant kubernetes dashboards
- Fixes datasource for the nginx dashboard
- Fixes templating variable for rabbitmq dashboard

Change-Id: I2fa1ff606746ce1f51d2ed01788bb5282bd53dfc

commit_message:
Prometheus: Update Alertmanager discovery, fix rules entry

Updates the service discovery mechanism used by Prometheus to
identify Alertmanager instances to push alerts to. It moves to
use the 'application' label to identify Alertmanager pods instead of
searching for pods by the label 'name', as the previous definition
was resulting in empty results for Alertmanager targets

This also fixes the name of the prometheus label used to track
alerts for kube-controller-manager, as it was defined incorrect
previously

Change-Id: I1fb194550baf803435722e3a01892e49b44259d1

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Icf39a1b5057e998d92923026a587ee3fdcb37c13
Partial-Bug: #1764470

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I5f7e8fd36185537543d0741d88a5ccc9cd1f1645
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit a686b93020ee8ab6dae364864dcb45ffb7255307)

commit_message:
Updating time for functional tests

Currenlty, some gates is being failed with logs like this

"""
b'Response: {"description": "Provided object does not match schema
\'Secret\': \'expiration\' is before current time.
Invalid property: \'expiration\'", "title": "Bad Request", "code": 400}'
"""

So it is necessary to update the time to create secrets successfully.

Change-Id: I59707cdf21f6843dbd7db30978e21cff72756e67
(cherry picked from commit af4637bcf2c0cb807fc8392c9e0e5d7d4404d92e)

commit_message:
WIP - Implement logging to file by default

This patch implements logging to ~/undercloud-install.log by default
during containerized undercloud installation.

Change-Id: I62304adb958ea10033fe1e9126cc6730938ebbfe
Related-Bug: 1761552

commit_message:
Switch amphora tarball to ubuntu xenial

Centos Amphora doesn't work properly with L2 configuration as it doesn't
reach its own VIP address. This commit switches the host os to ubuntu until
[1] is fixed.

[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/1715166

Change-Id: I43047fa4cc03d8c14ccaa7eebab1bdaa69e25360

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Ie71d42836014c2354e252389cc14e52a06b6f062
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 71a7b842472c3333e3736b00e98dfe81bf778a87)

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Ib57a7bc2a88a152e5f60e083c676fb1ce07deb18
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit b81c76cf5d27aedf598c038a7a6a99006459d478)

commit_message:
Added enable_tempest flag for installing tempest on undercloud

* In order to achieve the containerizing tempest goal, we need to
  make sure the tempest fake service is available on the undercloud
  so that it can be used for running tempest tests.

commit_message:
Add retries for Dogtag plugin

Some Dogtag gate failures appear to be from memory issues
that show up in NSS.  The Dogtag plugin should be made more
robust by adding a retry mechanism.  Failures from Dogtag should
also be better reported.

Change-Id: I148b1c8e265b327d60d76f88c036b032af014930
